This changeset tracks the changes needed by the Embrane's Neutron Plugin
in order to consistently  pass tempest tests.

Changes:

- Some db transactions were too long and were causing lock timeout
exception. Removed useless transactions (waiting on non-db tasks to complete)
to fix the problem.

- The operation filter was useless, and breaking the tests. Most of the
logic which guarantees the appliance correct state when an operation in executed
is now in the internal library used for the heleos APIs.
The filter was therefore removed (as well as the corresponding exception).

- Fixed "sync" mode. The behavior was incorrect due to the queue timeout.
Furthermore, parallel requests were not waiting on the correct thread.

- Added missing methods for floating IPs (not all the scenarios were covered).

- Minor bug fixes catched during the tests.

Change-Id: If081b50b4629158016ba421b94612a4cfac82257
Closes-Bug:1269098

commit_message:
Embrane Tempest Compliance

This changeset tracks the changes needed by the Embrane's Neutron Plugin
in order to consistently  pass tempest tests.

Changes:

- Some db transactions were too long and were causing lock timeout
exception. Removed useless transactions (waiting on non-db tasks to complete)
to fix the problem.

- The operation filter was useless, and breaking the tests. Most of the
logic which guarantees the appliance correct state when an operation in executed
is now in the internal library used for the heleos APIs.
The filter was therefore removed (as well as the corresponding exception).

- Fixed "sync" mode. The behavior was incorrect due to the queue timeout.
Furthermore, parallel requests were not waiting on the correct thread.

- Added missing methods for floating IPs (not all the scenarios were covered).

- Minor bug fixes caught during the tests.

Change-Id: If081b50b4629158016ba421b94612a4cfac82257
Closes-Bug:1269098

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Use backend floating IP endpoint

Adds new floating IP REST calls for backend
controllers that support it. Adds backend
capability discovery mechanism.

Implements: blueprint bsn-floating-ip-endpoints
Change-Id: I2301d62a05d256867255865556625603918e84cf

2. Volume cannot be attached

commit_message:
3PAR: Backend assisted volume migrate

This patch implements volume migrate using native 3PAR APIs.

Prerequisites:
1. Same 3PAR backend
2. Volume cannot be attached
3. Source and Dest CPGS are in the same domain

Steps:
1. Create a temporary volume in the destination with a copy of the source
2. Wait for the copy to complete
3. Delete the source
4. Rename the temporary to the same name as the original

Change-Id: Ia42503d41bf8afd908cd3ffb0288f0d353f313f1
Implements: blueprint native-3par-migrate-volume
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/13/73113/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add encrypted flag to volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-10 21:18:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1fdf2edc99bdef6b08c80866b30604373f6bb616', 'message': 'Add encrypted flag to volumes

Currently, the only way to determine whether a volume is encrypted
is by retrieving the encryption metadata about the volume (through
cinder.api.contrib.volume_encryption_metadata) and checking the
encryption_key_id value.  This patch adds an "encrypted" flag to
the basic volume api to enable other services (like Horizon) to
easily tell whether a volume is encrypted using a basic get call,
instead of requiring an additional call.

Implements blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/encrypt-cinder-volumes

commit_message:
Add encrypted flag to volumes

Currently, the only way to determine whether a volume is encrypted
is by retrieving the encryption metadata about the volume (through
cinder.api.contrib.volume_encryption_metadata) and checking the
encryption_key_id value.  This patch adds an "encrypted" flag to
the basic volume api to enable other services (like Horizon: see
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71125) to easily tell
whether a volume is encrypted using a basic get call,instead of
requiring an additional call.

Implements blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: Id8e422135f17795de06589930afd0309fde28fd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/83/72483/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Refactor Managers to a common base class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-14 20:13:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4c9ce4e44644cd869d8bdd72223bd629007a5bc3', 'message': 'Refactor credentials into an object

Multiversion auth bp part3 - WIP do not merge.

Introduces a Credential object.
Using Credentials, it becomes transparent for client managers
and tests which auth version is being used.
Defines a get_default_credentials utils, which is the overall
sole responsible for reading credentials from CONF.
Defines a get_credentials, which buils V2 or V3 credentials
based on configuration. Adds domain to configuration.

Refactor Manager to inherit from a common manager.Manager class
and accept Credentials at __init__

Adapts tenant isolation to return Credentials. In case of
auth_version v3, it still creates credentials using v2, and then
domain info is added into the generated credentials.
Adapts DataGenerator to return test_credentials.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-16 18:16:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/544c4d6c7baa64d61572c2e332ae248d35175fed', 'message': 'Refactor credentials into an object

Multiversion auth bp part3 - WIP do not merge.

Introduces a Credential object.
Using Credentials, it becomes transparent for client managers
and tests which auth version is being used.
Defines a get_default_credentials utils, which is the overall
sole responsible for reading credentials from CONF.
Defines a get_credentials, which buils V2 or V3 credentials
based on configuration. Adds domain to configuration.
Credentials can be filled-in using auth provider, an identity
admin client is not needed to obtain user_id and tenant_id.

Refactor Manager to inherit from a common manager.Manager class
and accept Credentials at __init__

Adapts tenant isolation to return Credentials. In case of
auth_version v3, it still creates credentials using v2, and then
domain info is added into the generated credentials.
Adapts DataGenerator to work with Credentials.

TBD in this patch: unit tests for credentials object V2 and V3.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: Iddacbaa4593b7cb4d32538a5cade814751c180e0

commit_message:
Refactor Managers to a common base class

Multiversion auth part3

Refactor client managers to inherit from a common manager.Manager
class. Moves scenario base manager to clients.py.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: Iddacbaa4593b7cb4d32538a5cade814751c180e0

commit_message:
Utilise ['openstack']['region'] from cookbook-openstack-common

- Set ['openstack']['orchestration']['region'] to equal ['openstack']['region']
- Add tests for endpoint creation, to confirm region is set.

Change-Id: Ie882f6da89f8e6a4324f7f19d3c9582671610629
Addresses: blueprint uniform-region

commit_message:
The 3PAR driver now recommends 3.1.3 firmware

The 3PAR driver now recommends/requires 3.1.3 firmware to ensure that
all tested driver capabilities are available.

Closes-Bug: #1283180
Change-Id: I4d1bcc801bb9cd58d73a9e6a9ca213cfd40db49d

commit_message:
Sync oslo imageutils, strutils to cinder

Changes in imageutils:
===============================
bec3a5e Implements SI/IEC unit system conversion to bytes
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
aad179d Fixing misspelled encryption key in QemuImgInfo
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
2bd46eb Refactors byte size extraction logic

Changes in strutils:
====================
bec3a5e Implements SI/IEC unit system conversion to bytes
e53fe85 strutils bool_from_string, allow specified default
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
84d461e Fix a bug in safe_encode where it returns a bytes object in py3
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
3970d46 Fix typos in oslo
1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
67bd769 python3: Fix traceback while running python3.
b0c51ec Refactors to_bytes

Change-Id: I765bcd40f959162874bfda412b69e673c6e5f732
Related-bug: #1189635
Related-bug: #1193765
Related-Bug: #1257829
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/46/66246/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support for FC zone lifecycle management
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-31 02:50:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d9ff133542666f1279b9d0a3d5efefd1d4da7314', 'message': 'Add support for FC zone lifecycle management

Allows automated zone lifecycle management in the attach/detach
entry points of the volume manager for FC volumes (when fabric
zoning is enabled). Zones are configured automatically as part
of the active zone set in the FC SAN to provide a more flexible
and secure way of controlling access. FC zone manager enables
SAN vendors to add support for pluggable implementations.

TODO: Base PWWN lookup support

Change-Id: I86e02e11afec71ffa25dfbcbd0dc3ddcc35741ea
Implements: blueprint cinder-fc-zone-manager

commit_message:
Add support for FC zone lifecycle management

Allows automated zone lifecycle management in the attach/detach
entry points of the volume manager for FC volumes (when fabric
zoning is enabled). Zones are configured automatically as part
of the active zone set in the FC SAN to provide a more flexible
and secure way of controlling access. FC zone manager enables
SAN vendors to add support for pluggable implementations.

Change-Id: I86e02e11afec71ffa25dfbcbd0dc3ddcc35741ea
Implements: blueprint cinder-fc-zone-manager

subject: Add x-openstack-request-id to cinder responses
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-15 04:24:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/2e962c7a0678410a1e5e322a4d229dcaad890af0', 'message': 'Add x-openstack-request-id to cinder responses

x-openstack-request-id is the common header name for request ID going forward.
Currently, only glance and neutron return this header. Using the request_id
middleware is a convenient way to ensure this header is in the response. We will
also be using the middleware to generate the request ID.

The ID will be generated by the middleware and is inserted into the request
environment. The current code generates the request ID in the constructor of
RequestConext; with this change, the ID is generated beforehand and passed in to
the RequestContext constructor. Not much different here: a request ID is
generated and is available for use in the handling of the request.

On the response end, the middleware is again used, this time to attach the
x-openstack-request-id header, using the value of the generated request ID. The
current code attaches the x-compute-request-id header.

This change is a necessary step toward logging the mapping of request IDs across
OpenStack services.

UpgradeImpact: api-paste.ini is modified

Change-Id: I30c4e5efa77f9ebffb485d2ea6a6c3f78eb1573f
Implements: blueprint add-standard-req-id-header

Change-Id: I30c4e5efa77f9ebffb485d2ea6a6c3f78eb1573f
Implements: blueprint add-standard-req-id-header

commit_message:
Add x-openstack-request-id to cinder responses

x-openstack-request-id is the common header name for request ID going forward.
Currently, only glance and neutron return this header. Using the request_id
middleware is a convenient way to ensure this header is in the response. We will
also be using the middleware to generate the request ID.

The ID will be generated by the middleware and is inserted into the request
environment. The current code generates the request ID in the constructor of
RequestConext; with this change, the ID is generated beforehand and passed in to
the RequestContext constructor. Not much different here: a request ID is
generated and is available for use in the handling of the request.

On the response end, the middleware is again used, this time to attach the
x-openstack-request-id header, using the value of the generated request ID. The
current code attaches the x-compute-request-id header.

This change is a necessary step toward logging the mapping of request IDs across
OpenStack services.

UpgradeImpact: api-paste.ini is modified

Change-Id: I30c4e5efa77f9ebffb485d2ea6a6c3f78eb1573f
Implements: blueprint add-standard-req-id-header

commit_message:
Cleanup node['cpu']['total'] work-around for fauxhai

The fauxhai fix for the cpu stanza has merged and is available in fauxhai
version 2.1.0 so reverting the workaround patch and ensuring fauxhai 2.1.0
is used.

- Remove node.set for ['cpu']['total'] in the spec tests
- Adjust the Gemfile to use fauxhai 2.1.0
- Adjust the Gemfile.lock

Change-Id: Ida6f840b6d6b28512cdfac841d51ac2fc94fdb6f
Addresses: blueprint fauxhai-Cleanup

commit_message:
Remove oslo rpc

The rpc module was a dependency that was needed for the notifier module.
Since the notifier and rpc modules have been incorporated into oslo.messaging,
there is no need for the sync'd versions from oslo-incubator. This change
removes the oslo-incubator rpc module.

Change-Id: I00f7ae3e71c0df0de22e1371c6eee372230384f2
Blueprint: oslo-messaging

commit_message:
don't check for service enabled

service enabled is something that's not required for sysstat and
friends, because instead we actually can do this with screen_it.

Change-Id: I4aa5787101cb0def46690f38a7f82effbb85f502

subject: Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 20:16:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/df73e07a0788b4d76198938acfc362e38503f6d2', 'message': 'Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove misguided warning

Introduce a config option, mysql_sql_mode, that allows the user
to set the desired SQL mode for MySQL sessions.

For MySQL sessions, set the SQL mode session variable
accordingly.

For compatibility purposes, retain the mysql_traditional_mode
argument in method signatures, but only use it to override the
config option as if it were set to 'TRADITIONAL'.

SQL injection considerations: the value of mysql_sql_mode
is guarded via StrOpt "choices", an invalid or malicious value
would raise a ValueError for the config option. A malicious
application could still call _set_session_sql_mode with a value
that injects unwanted SQL.

Change-Id: Ia527e850671ab9542db5864617384cee21e91bf6
Closes-bug: 1271706
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-22 23:10:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/8c0b343b7d145faa0de5d48a42fc762775e82fc0', 'message': 'Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove misguided warning

would raise a ValueError for the config option. A malicious
application could still call _set_session_sql_mode with a value
that injects unwanted SQL.

commit_message:
Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning

Introduce a config option, mysql_sql_mode, that allows the user
to set the desired SQL mode for MySQL sessions.

For MySQL sessions, set the SQL mode session variable
accordingly.

For compatibility purposes, retain the mysql_traditional_mode
argument in method signatures, but only use it to override the
config option as if it were set to 'TRADITIONAL'.

Change-Id: Ia527e850671ab9542db5864617384cee21e91bf6
Closes-bug: 1271706
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/74/68474/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Rename Neutron core/service plugins for VMware NSX
revisions:

commit_message:
Rename Neutron core/service plugins for VMware NSX

Short aliases are introduced for the NSX plugin(s). This patch
also switches to using the new plugin names/naming scheme in
the unit tests.

Partial-implements blueprint: nicira-plugin-renaming

Change-Id: If1f1431b098bf77b9c85e0afb3d7848083d9d451

commit_message:
Introduce a method to set any MySQL session SQL mode

Rather than implement a method just for the special case of setting
MySQL TRADITIONAL mode, implement one that can set any supported
server mode, and reimplement the old method as a wrapper around that.

In addition, check the actual effective SQL mode
(as per SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'sql_mode'), and log a warning if it's
deemed unsafe.

Co-author: Ben Nemec <openstack@nemebean.com>

Change-Id: I90139b915b2ff169878fd93625e5320d39094ed3

commit_message:
libvirt-volume: improve unit test time

A number of tests would invoke code that would sleep. This
patch adds a mocked function for the sleep.

Change-Id: I804a86e3b8b750919cf7a9547ef514f833a5fd49
Related-bug: #1279820

commit_message:
Update RHOS to 4.0

Updated satellite and RHSM RHOS channel names
Updated rhel-boot-image package and ISO filename
Updated paths to 6.5
Removed libqb workaround
Removed swift-ring-builder workaround

Change-Id: I4310477e8b08a990b083fab26fd297f3fc4372a7
Closes-Bug: #1267802

commit_message:
Base tests for stop/reset environment feature

Add next tests to verify stop/reset feature:
* Stop deployment on deploy task. No ready nodes
  add cinder node. Redeploy
* stop deployment on provisioning task
  Add node. Redeploy (skip for now)
* Reset on ready enviroment. Update
  networks. Redeploy.
* Deploy HA with 3 controllers. Stop.
  Add 2 computes. Redeploy. Verify

Closes-bug: #1277039
Change-Id: I7ffe6217541ed65f83c7e397da44683cec57baa9

commit_message:
Fix nodes deletion from cobbler in case of offline nodes

We must send offline nodes to orchestrator
to delete it from cobbler.

Change-Id: I59b1f427ae61aa36e9a301b089cb2f08a107a725
Closes-bug: #1283825

subject: options: consolidate options definitions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-14 07:39:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4c48da48eabb8ab05bc509bd17a4d6764c5f70d9', 'message': 'options: consolidate options definitions

Some config options(interface_driver, use_namespaces, periodic_interval)
are defined multiple times in ad-hoc way.  It causes DuplicateOptError
exception when using those module at the same time.  Right now the exception
is avoided in ad-hoc way by each executables.  Those duplicated
definition/registering should be consolidated and treated in uniformed way.

This is the blocker for blueprint: l3-agent-consolidation

Closes-bug: #1279769
Change-Id: Ifed79b7ee0033644854499416f8a2b22a20416fe
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-14 16:11:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fe7d47b4621584d32dd2588efdb851a5b72b0505', 'message': 'options: consolidate options definitions

Some config options(interface_driver, use_namespaces) are defined
multiple times in ad-hoc way.  It causes DuplicateOptError exception
when using those module at the same time.  Right now the exception is
avoided in ad-hoc way by each executables.  Those duplicated
definition/registering should be consolidated and treated in uniformed
way.

This is the blocker for blueprint: l3-agent-consolidation

neutron.services.loadbalancer.driver.haproxy.agent.py has
periodic_interval conflicted with neutron.service. Since There is no
way to fix it without chainging existing behavior/default value, it
is untouched for now.

Closes-bug: #1279769
Change-Id: Ifed79b7ee0033644854499416f8a2b22a20416fe
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-14 16:19:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/48c4ea56dafaf6e6954d51651f18c91b3694b939', 'message': 'options: consolidate options definitions

commit_message:
options: consolidate options definitions

Some config options(interface_driver, use_namespaces) are defined
multiple times in ad-hoc way.  It causes DuplicateOptError exception
when using those module at the same time.  Right now the exception is
avoided in ad-hoc way by each executable.  Those duplicated
definitions should be consolidated and treated in uniformed way.

This is the blocker for blueprint: l3-agent-consolidation

neutron.services.loadbalancer.drivers.haproxy.agent periodic_interval
conflicts with neutron.service one. Since there is no way to fix it
without changing existing behavior/default value, it is untouched for now.

Closes-bug: #1279769
Change-Id: Ifed79b7ee0033644854499416f8a2b22a20416fe

commit_message:
Allow log_dir to be set to false in order to disable file logging

This commit allows a user to disable logging to a directory (for
example if syslog is enabled, in order to not log twice).

Conflicts: spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb

Closes-bug: #1282296
(cherry picked from commit 603fb207959fe6fdeca2029c29c18342fc2d6b60)
Change-Id: I814bf8199fcf57f976e95b9bbf872478694b9d3e

commit_message:
Add log_dir param. by default and allow users to disable it

  * add log_dir param (and configure it to /var/log/glance) by default.
  * fix log_file missing setting on glance::registry
  * allow users to disable log_dir and log_file with « false » argument.

Change-Id: I0689fa15199e69cf16ff306050776d150365a09c
Closes-bug: #1282296

commit_message:
Add log_dir param. by default and allow users to disable it

This commit add log_dir param and configures it to /var/log/cinder
(default location). Set log_dir to false allows users to disable logging
to a directory (usefull if syslog is enabled in order not to log twice).

Closes-bug: #1282296
(cherry picked from commit 96e4a0a670aaa073b9a101409181df4e4284746d)
Change-Id: I8b8d72f8c9551ffb1a4f73575013d70e985f274c

commit_message:
Fix test for cloud loadbalancer

Current properties schema of loadbalancer does not contain 'enabled'
property. This option is used as constant in 'add_ssl_termination'
call. So that logic should be same for the tests.

Change-Id: Ife5d90535ad31e0b8ab9e168e0be044cf30f6293

commit_message:
timestamp sublogs

the sublogs really need timestamps so they can be indexed in
logstash, and we can then actually understand when things might
be failing.

basic logic brought in from devstack, with some changes for
millisecond timing.

Change-Id: Iede34b970d090f855c701b69c1f5167a08ab9c52

commit_message:
Add log_dir param. by default and allow users to disable it

This commit add log_dir param and configures it to /var/log/keystone
(default location). Set log_dir to false allows users to disable logging
to a directory (usefull if syslog is enabled in order not to log twice).

(cherry picked from commit 5a48d7d4fb0916695f6a8d29db47f46123398ee0)
Change-Id: I83446ff8b70c1cc136c9e1bb24513006ac9cb5a8

commit_message:
Improve help strings

Follow oslo.config style guide for help strings better:
* Capitalize start of strings
* End strings with "."
* Improve text and grammar
* Add missing spaces

Change-Id: I09d15bdf002c0f2847dc08628d11f8f5199e76bf

Add Bind9 Support to the DevStack Plugin

Allow bind9 as an available backend to be installed
with a DevStack instance.

blueprint bind9-devstack

commit_message:
Implement user-defined tenant for neutron nets

Default networks were previously hardcoded to use
"admin" as the tenant, regardless of user input.
This patch is a workaround because nailgun creates
neutron_config with admin tenant hardcoded as well.

FIXMEs were added to indicate what code needs cleanup
after nailgun is patched.

Change-Id: I272b53b6dbb4e972f94e82e81b58920351f4144d
Partial-Bug: #1267431

Fix spec test for sanitize neutron config

Added access hash to config to match defaults
for deployment

Change-Id: Ib0ab5f2a532db824572f05c94673be48869fe731
Related-Bug: 1267431

commit_message:
Allow log_dir to be set to false in order to disable file logging

This commit allows a user to disable logging to a directory (for
example if syslog is enabled) in order not to login twice.

Change-Id: I0e64cf62f556d40d9243b05b4d0253dddc42b686
Closes-bug: #1282296
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/67/74767/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate logdir parameter (use log_dir instead)

The logdir parameter is deprecated since grizzly, we now use log_dir
instead. (the retro-compatibility is kept)
Cosmetics: align all parameters of nova class.

Closes-bug: #1282295
Change-Id: I20b3dee628205d53779afc4db7506a0701ad1bd4

commit_message:
Change execution place of ressource execute['glance-manage version_control 0'] in recipes/registry.rb

The ressource execute['glance-manage version_control 0'] crash when you change the glance db password
because the ressource template['/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf'] is not yet updated with the new password at the time.
This fix change the order of execution of the ressource execute['glance-manage version_control 0'] to fix that issue.

Change-Id: I3376c8ad4da90bef22c595945a984233f22222fb
Closes-Bug: #1282941

commit_message:
Add a new rally command: show

Introduce a new rally command that gives information about a specific
deployment. At the moment, it is able to inform about the available:
* images
* flavors
* networks
* security groups
* keypairs
of a deployment.

Implements: blueprint rally-show-command
Change-Id: Id7d8cdf2a89fe1f72436203dc02e996c2e1b45bd

commit_message:
An initial implementation of a 1.0 based messaging driver

This uses the proton protocol engine library from the Apache Qpid project. The
driver has its own IO thread and event loop. The files under engine are really
generic and could at some point be separated into their own library or folded
into the engine library itself somehow. The key driver interface is implemented
in driver.py, tmost of the logic of mapping to AMQP 1.0 is in controller.py and
the eventloop.py is also fairly generic.

Change-Id: I094f6b41827b42fe38637b10cb5b35467e886665
Implements: blueprint amqp10-driver-implementation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/90/75890/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ui elements for CentOS to use kernel-ml

Adds new option to vlan splinters settings to enable Fedora main-line kernel
 currently 3.11

When chosen will send kernel_ml: 1 in ks-meta to cobbler

requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/75243/

commit_message:
Nova V2 APIs for Domain Quota Management

V2 APIs in Nova for using Domain Quota Driver to manage the quotas at domain, project and user level.
These APIs will enable Nova to enforce domain quotas. These APIs are implemented using new extension
domain-quota-sets

Change-Id: I678104037552b97949777d00fe5923ad5c4874f4
Implements: blueprint domain-quota-driver-api

commit_message:
Replaced "...\'%s\'..." with "...'%s'..."

We can use "'" without "\" if we use it inside of double quote pair.

Change-Id: Ia8be708611fb0f7053960773a7e32ad8f3121fd3

commit_message:
Prevent caller from specifying id during Migration.create()

The patch is to remove id when it was set before creating a migration
in objects, and check if the migration exists before it is created.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I37ff279f5f74d17ce9c173458ff35826fb10f143

reason.  I happened to find the problem because I had a file named

Change-Id: Ia10cfbd4b99d821d9a725e6eb256fdd8ab001405

commit_message:
migration.db_sync requires an engine now

One of the migration test cases was still not passing an engine to
db_sync.  This doesn't show up in the gate because it is a negative
test that was failing with the correct exception for a different
reason.  I happened to find the problem because I had a file named
foo in my oslo-incubator directory from some previous testing and foo
was being passed in as the repository path, so that call wasn't
failing like it would on a clean system such as the gate.

Change-Id: Ia10cfbd4b99d821d9a725e6eb256fdd8ab001405

commit_message:
Mark files graduating to oslotest

Place clear markers at the top of the files that are moving
to oslotest. We shouldn't normally need to do this, but
not everything in the fixture directory moved.

commit_message:
Prevent caller from specifying id during ComputeNode.create()

The patch is to remove id when it was set before creating a compute
node in objects, so it can be generated automatically.

And check if the node exists before it is created.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: Ib808643bff24b683ef330b5a1be5bc68ece30184

commit_message:
Disable RHOS for 4.1 release

Due to recent package changes, RH is not
compatible with Fuel Library in its current
state. This patch should be reverted after
the necessary workarounds are in place to
provide RHOS in the future.

Change-Id: I887d48a5014dd9e17f4834eaa5a012768e298df1
Related-Bug: 1283072

commit_message:
Define $user referenced in db.pp

In db.pp, in the exec 'ceilometer dbsync' ressource the user
is supposed to be $::ceilometer::params::user, but it was
not defined.

(cherry picked from commit e6c191194312935ea01c97ae667bf3ea1a912f81)

Conflicts:
	spec/classes/ceilometer_db_spec.rb

Change-Id: I888be405f418932c0e46ce8e82486755d36fc7bf

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-22 11:12:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user_role/keystone.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/8f5ef592172e7a71aabb2a38e812af775c4985b3', 'message': 'Load tenant un-lazily if needed

The laziness added to the role to reduce keystone
lookups assumes that all tenants are present in @tenants
if they are present in the system, and will not refresh
the class variable if the tenant is not found in it.

This patch adds a keystone lookup in the event of the supplied
tenant not being in the class variable, which can happen if a

Change-Id: I48b13f6abc906cde4794dd46d7938126aae204b1
(cherry picked from commit 9f7fe1827348d69a6d8b62c0a334612064cca554)

commit_message:
Load tenant un-lazily if needed

The laziness added to the role to reduce keystone
lookups assumes that all tenants are present in @tenants
if they are present in the system, and will not refresh
the class variable if the tenant is not found in it.

This patch adds a keystone lookup in the event of the supplied
tenant not being in the class variable, which can happen if a
tenant is created after prefetching.

Change-Id: I48b13f6abc906cde4794dd46d7938126aae204b1
(cherry picked from commit 9f7fe1827348d69a6d8b62c0a334612064cca554)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/28/75628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make service_plugins configurable

So far, the service_plugins configuration setting of neutron server has
been used exclusivly for the loadbalancer plugin.  However, in different
usage contexts it can be used for more.  Therefore, this change makes
the service_plugins setting configurable.

This change deprecates node["openstack"]["network"]["neutron_loadbalancer"].
To use the loadbalancer as a service plugin, please add

  neutron.plugins.services.agent_loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin

to node['openstack']['network']['service_plugins']

Change-Id: I6f1cf72f7bbb9625dbace778189f938841bfbe2b

commit_message:
Add session argument to call QpidMessage constructor

This patch addresses bug 1282787 by adding session argument to
call the QpidMessage constructor. The following error is
produced: __init__() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given).

Closes-Bug: #1282787

Change-Id: I792c45116fc68d1e4247353d4545dc7d1b3bd44e

commit_message:
add epel repo if adding rdo repo

Fixes: bug 1282908
Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-common

All RDO packages depend on lots of packages from epel. if we have RDO we
have to have epel.

Change-Id: Ie00b22c77e03a4df6835e1df7523509af8976a35

commit_message:
Enable flake8 F841 checking - Part 1

This check looks to see whether a local variable
is unused. Fixed a part of violators of said check.
Tox.ini has not changed yet.

Change-Id: I041573c76e30c43d88b41f3ee348bd385f122284

subject: Do eventlet.monkey_patch at the very beginning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-12 16:56:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/abe84c673088213eeae2af6ed99371dee92ad711', 'message': "Do eventlet.monkey_patch it the very beginning

According to the docs
http://eventlet.net/doc/patching.html#eventlet.patcher.monkey_patch
the monkey patching should be done as early as possible. Not sure how we've
missed that requirement. In fact it is very important. For instance my
threadlocal didn't work until I've moved monkey_patch to the beginning.
I have a feeling that could be the reason of some issues we experienced
in the past.

Change-Id: I0a266a75ca0d43f4d639f4c8666d8e0c07de5552

Change-Id: I0a266a75ca0d43f4d639f4c8666d8e0c07de5552
"}]
commit_message:
Do eventlet.monkey_patch at the very beginning

According to the docs
http://eventlet.net/doc/patching.html#eventlet.patcher.monkey_patch
the monkey patching should be done as early as possible. Not sure how we've
missed that requirement. In fact it is very important. For instance my
threadlocal didn't work until I've moved monkey_patch to the beginning.
I have a feeling that could be the reason of some issues we experienced
in the past.

Also contains fix for theadlocal from Sergey Lukjanov.

Also fixes unittests to pass with the new code.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Lukjanov <slukjanov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I0a266a75ca0d43f4d639f4c8666d8e0c07de5552

commit_message:
Python3: fix bytes/str issues

In Python 3, tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile().write() takes bytes as input,
not a text string. Make sure we use bytes in the tests. Also, completely
fix test_get_template_contents_file by passing a string to
template_utils.get_template_contents().

Change-Id: I49070b32e44a405740e3150ccc357ec375f41e64

commit_message:
Add kernel_ml options to cobbler scripts

Add support to pass ks_meta kernel_ml = 1 to cobbler. This will cause the package
 kernel-ml to be added in the CentOS profile.

kernel-ml is the Fedora main-line kernel and might be desired in some cases to help
 prevent vlan splinters issues for some network cards.

Closes-bug: #1263072
Related-bug: #1282493

Change-Id: I0d65b0b64feea05c413c86d37c30d9ccabf870c8

types - json and xml, class RestClientXML becomes redundant.

This is useful when one picks mongodb as a backend and wants to use replicaset

commit_message:
Allow db fields configuration without doing the dbsync

This commit allows one to configure the db fields without running the actual
dbsync command. It remains compliant with the current implementation, leaving
exec {'ceilometer-dbsync': in the catalog. One, now, can decide if it wants
the dbsync to take place or not.

This is useful when one picks mongodb as a backend and wants to use replicaset
This way it can scale horizontally and painlessly using the initSync feature
of mongodb. With this pattern one can add new member of the replica set
easily.

Change-Id: I8618bb385147176512fbda1540ba75ac95fccbf1
(cherry picked from commit 1aa1d795f0c06bb5266886b8599814e61fbef3f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/31/75331/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix create_heat_accounts domain setting

The following changes were required to get heat.conf stack_user_domain
be correctly set:
- Use $SERVICE_TOKEN since $OS_SERVICE_TOKEN didn't appear to be set
- do the iniset from create_heat_accounts, since it actually runs after
  configure_heat

Change-Id: I81fe4e3a81b60a6bfe7de1a8c5deed6adcf26c8b

subject: Handle invalid pagination parameters

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 19:21:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/7f9189e96a6eecf4b86c27df9c4af9c158e97016', 'message': 'Handle invalid pagination parameters

Giving incorrect values for limit, sort_dir result in ValueError.
Incorrect sort key results in InvalidSortKey.  Incorrect marker
results in StatementError.

These exceptions are now handled and return a ValueError or
InvalidSortKey with a 400 response.
Closes-Bug: 1282682

commit_message:
Handle invalid pagination parameters

The api checks sort_dir, sort_key and limit.
Incorrect sort_dir throws InvalidSortDir.
Incorrect sort key throws InvalidSortKey.
Incorrect limit throws InvalidLimit

Storage checks for marker.
Incorrect marker results in InvalidMarker.

Closes-Bug: 1282682
Change-Id: I993c82479cace5a285fdba480fbd8bccb53a0aeb

commit_message:
nova-kvm: configure /etc/sysconfig/libvirtd

Adds the --listen option to the /etc/sysconfig/libvirtd file.
This would be required for migrations on distributions that use
this file.

This commit also fixes an issue w/ a21a2e7 where the debian
style file was copied into place on *all* distributions.
We should avoid writing unnecessary files to disk where
possible. As part of this fix the file was moved from being
configured w/ os-config-apply into the install.d. It is unlikely
these files will change often so I think this is Okay...

Change-Id: I3725897744c13184d72475e137ff9267ee5449fc
Closes-bug: #1279356

   returned with 0 (EXIT_SUCCESS) exit status.

Change-Id: Ifb71c58a2f676f8a3427160dbc5cfeab61d13b56
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stress runner exit issues

1. The stress runner in parallel run, regardless to the test failures
   returned with 0 (EXIT_SUCCESS) exit status.
2. Stress runner did not stopped run in serial execution, when the stop
   on first failure was enabled.

Change-Id: Ifb71c58a2f676f8a3427160dbc5cfeab61d13b56

commit_message:
Change default policy for volume_extension:volume_tenant_attribute

The volume_tenant_attribute extension should be accessible by
the owning tenant and the admin. Change default policy from
'rule:admin_api' to 'rule:admin_or_owner'.

Change-Id: I886cd717741c86b5083aeaf16e3e7ea5b4e525b4
Closes-bug: #1269312

commit_message:
Fix FC connection handling in the storwize driver

Creating FC connections was not working due to several issues:

1. The lsfabric command in the Storwize/SVC omitted the delimeter and so
the output was not correctly parsed by the driver.
2. In some cases comparisons of WWPNs were not case insensitive - ensure
we compare lower-case WWPNs.
3. If the host supplied extra information in the connector (e.g. iSCSI
initiator name in case of an FC setup, or FC WWNNs/WWPNs in an iSCSI
setup), the driver would try to make those host mappings on the storage
too.  This could lead into unwanted behaviour and confusing error
messages (for example, in an FC setup reaching the maximum number of
iSCSI mappings).

In addition, unit tests weren't properly testing FC - instead they were
always testing iSCSI due to an error in parsing extra_specs. This patch
fixes that error and the unit tests as well.

These changes must all be made together for unit tests to pass.

Closes-bug: 1279758
Change-Id: I64e21609ba089cf5bfd52ce2644f6f229bcc69dc

commit_message:
Fix webob.exc.HTTPForbidden parameter miss

HTTPForbidden should use the parameter 'explanation'
instead of 'detail'.
This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I688145f7ea942277c7d3ed3221d6ff2bc7a852ad
Closes-Bug: #1283872

commit_message:
Allow IPv6 tests to be disabled

By default they are enabled. This is useful if
certain plugins do not fully support IPv6, or if
the 3rd party CI is set up for IPv4 only.

Closes-bug: 1282387

Change-Id: I6d402381474d70c5f7a4fe378c0459c9b3a92085

commit_message:
Pass the session to QpidMessage constructor

The patch in I6e37780cc28737cfd56b6719ec8d9cebbc9bb278 added a new class
for the QpidMessage which was wrongly initialized when processing a
message.

Change-Id: Iaf525fc6ee9e56100c89863f9c651f20c148ecb5
Closes-Bug: 1282038

commit_message:
Fix dummy lock missing pending_writers method

In order to make sure other methods are not missed
add a base abstract class that contains the methods
a reader/writer lock needs to implement and derive
from it for the two lock variations we currently have.

Change-Id: I482cd0c6852e56e94149410d3c71890c55f25ae1

commit_message:
Switch to using the type checking decode_json

To avoid the problem of user file modification
into json of a non-dictionary type we should use
the decode_json helper that checks the root elements
type to help protect against these types of misuse.

Change-Id: I85889eaeee90650bc9b33f7e9ef7424eab8750b2

commit_message:
Add support for PartialTask list

- partial-task: Task that includes all the values except the 'Text'
columns(input, result & message).
- This patch is to have the database to return a partial-task list on users
invoking 'GET /v2/tasks'.
- Returning list of partial tasks will help in reducing the response time when the
user queries for the list of tasks.
- This patch also includes changes for making implementation and return values of
display task detail (GET /v2/tasks/{task_id}) and list tasks (GET /v2/tasks)
more explicit.

partially implements bp async-glance-workers

Change-Id: I4fbadc9a97e3147128c7c733384c7bb50918806f

commit_message:
Javascript detection of unused variables

    This option will track unused variables in javascript and throw an
error. This configuration allow unused parameters that are followed by
a used parameter.

Change-Id: Iffdd85f6efeed667439a4886be6a985c6a9fbfd3
Implements: blueprint jshint-codestyle

commit_message:
Correct memory usage reported by compute

Report the maximum of reserved_host_memory_mb and
the actual value of memory used by compute host.

Fix for bug #1266415

subject: Allow concurrent image downloads in pxe logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-24 10:49:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/0309398624db6bcb6ad5ff03304902e8a873dd84', 'message': 'Allow concurrent image downloads in pxe logic

Currently we have a few methods that download images in pxe. They
are called one by one, also multiple images are downloaded using loop.
This patch refactors those methods so they gather the info needed for
download in a list, and the dedicated method starts concurrent
downloads using this list.

Also this patch normalizes code comments that have become jumbled with
time.

Change-Id: I6a6ecf415592c05a794f930a11aaa83946c438fe
Closes-Bug: 1199665
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-30 17:32:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/47f6f3df351ee40d07032d3f76abc5f8f0b46a1d', 'message': 'Allow concurrent image downloads in pxe logic

Currently we have a few methods that download images in pxe. They
are called one by one, also multiple images are downloaded using loop.
This patch refactors those methods so they gather the info needed for
download in a list, and the dedicated method starts concurrent
downloads using this list.

Also this patch normalizes code comments that have become jumbled with
time.

commit_message:
Allow concurrent image downloads in pxe logic

Currently we have a few methods that download images in pxe. They
are called one by one, also multiple images are downloaded using loop.
This patch refactors those methods so they gather the info needed for
download in a list, and the dedicated method starts concurrent
downloads using this list.

Also this patch normalizes code comments that have become jumbled with
time.

Change-Id: I6a6ecf415592c05a794f930a11aaa83946c438fe
Closes-Bug: #1199665

commit_message:
Base64 decode to test token

To test if a token is a valid ASN1 based token,
perform base64 decode and parse the ASN1 data.

Since this is a relatively expensive operations, instead of
returning true, the validation returns the parsed data, which is
evaluates to True.

Change-Id: I3c8354b32d47c002b01ca319130acdd279aef3a2

commit_message:
Add LazyPluggable object

LazyPluggable is an object used to load a specific module based upon the
value of a config option.

LazyPluggable can be found in at least: Glance, Cinder, Heat, Nova,
Ironic and Tuskar.

Change-Id: I345329f6eb077eff218e6ad8c6e930fac9aeff86

commit_message:
Remove backwards compatibility for API ext path

Extension path was changed back in Grizzly. This backwards compatibility
and warning was in place then, but we're now approaching EOL for Grizzly
after Icehouse, so remove it.

Change-Id: I8733a71213810ea1bd4abee07b195f6ed36c5600

commit_message:
Fix devstack job failure

There was a change [1] in tempest which is breaking our devstack job.
For SolumClient use publicURL as enpoint_type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/62887

Change-Id: I0164d05be09dec2b4bc0e1afe1a507c24324508b

commit_message:
Make metaplugin be used with a router service plugin

"l3_plugin_list" configuration parameter of the metaplugin is permitted
blank now.
If "l3_plugin_list" is blank, router extension and extensions which extend
the router extension don't be included in "supported-extension-aliases" of
the metaplugin.
This makes the metaplugin be able to be used with a router service plugin.
Note that if "l3_plugin_list" is not blank, a router service plugin must
not be specified, otherwise the error of the bug report still occurs.

This patch removes some router extension related meaningless codes also.
(e.g.  external-net extension belongs to L2 functionality and be handled
 by core plugins properly.)

Closes-bug: 1266347
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0454bc0a4bd7eda5dad18b0538fb7baebe0b9f91

commit_message:
Move volume snapshots table to volumes panel

Now that instance snapshots are just images, the images & snapshots
page only has images and volume snapshots. This is an odd combination.
I think we should now move volume snapshots to the volumes panel,
since a volume snapshot is tied to a volume.

Closes-Bug: #1190843
Change-Id: I3e12cec8b859a30db9f131e9889a92277e064086

commit_message:
Replace security.ubuntu.com when setting mirror

The current method to rewrite the mirror URL in the ubuntu element will
only rewrite archive.ubuntu.com, which leaves the security URL alone.
This is probably not intended for people who are creating images behind
firewalls.

Change-Id: I54a867e0e9d5a7c94324a5c00ff1a83b4e6e4524

commit_message:
Update orchestration-related service names in template catalog

The orchestration-related service names were not consistent with
the other AWS compatibility and native API names, so this change
makes them consistent.

Related-Bug: #1240138
Change-Id: I29a26bc6b0ddab0bff579a900e28da65df097a96

commit_message:
Add RHEL7 beta support

RHEL7 still in beta status, so it will require the FORCE option,
until the GA release.

The main notable difference from another RHEL family members, it does
not have the mysql alias for the mariadb.

Change-Id: Ic90bb6c3dd9447fc80453c3dc1adb22cdfc6226f

commit_message:
Support grenade-svm-rolling rename to *-partial-ncpu

I273b82fe2bb449d497f565fe1e2e14e4ea0a59e9 added support for a rolling
upgrade test, we have decided to call it partial-ncpu instead, also
grenade now takes a list of services to hold back
(Ifb733ee2fe0c5bba61b43ae19dca7040c12f7893).

Related devstack-infra/config patch: Ic680502d4dcc0a8677749bc38bf57b6c76c881f7

Change-Id: Icdf43128539e5eee24e47f81b236cede31755a00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/60/73460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support for running tempest serially without tenant isolation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-10 14:45:13.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/a5256d293121a862fe0f0a6a3404b2a6c4cb58f6', 'message': 'Add support for running tempest serially without tenant isolation

This commit adds a new env variable for devstack-gate:

DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_DISABLE_TENANT_ISOLATION

which is used to disable tenant isolation. If this option is set
it will also run tempest serially instead of in parallel. This
depends on tempest commit: I886b3fd416b2063df5daaca8d17ac6fbbdfe399e

Change-Id: Ida532021e1287efed09343e8e546d0605355e889
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for running tempest serially without tenant isolation

This commit adds a new env variable for devstack-gate:

DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_DISABLE_TENANT_ISOLATION

which is used to disable tenant isolation. If this option is set
it will also run tempest serially instead of in parallel. This
depends on tempest commit: I886b3fd416b2063df5daaca8d17ac6fbbdfe399e

Change-Id: Ida532021e1287efed09343e8e546d0605355e889
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/65/72365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

To keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.urllib.parse to
replace urlparse.

Closes-Bug: #1279611
Change-Id: I712035926f449e1bc5ab1fe85927369b826cb9cc

commit_message:
Uses the venv virtualenv for the pep8 command

The pep8 command doesn't really need to be in its own virtualenv. It can
easily share one with docs and sample_config.

commit_message:
Start compressing config files too

This commit starts gzipping the config files that are copied to the
log directory. Previously this was overlooked because there weren't
any conf files copied.

commit_message:
Install libffi-dev needed by python-glanceclient

Note that there is also a patch open to do this in
prepare_node_tripleo in the infra/config tree, if/when that lands this
could be reverted.

I've also moved the apt-get update to the front of the script as a
prophylatic against archive skew.

Change-Id: I136d9028b3e13e0cadabea553edd31519c30b562

Remove Fn::FindInMap from HOT

Since HOT doesn't include a Mappings section, this function can't ever do
anything useful.

commit_message:
Add documentation for Images API v2 show-image-member call

Image sharing was added to Images v2.1, but the show image
member call was not documented.  This patch adds the missing
documentation.

New and improved using the present tense!

Change-Id: I9924a91c30e150e7e9a5a7b62f099336b56e62d3
Closes-Bug: #1282381

'}]
commit_message:
Disallow Heat-only functions in CloudFormation templates

For CloudFormation templates (containing the AWSTemplateFormatVersion key),
allow only the built-in functions defined by CloudFormation. Templates
wishing to use Heat extensions should use the HeatTemplateFormatVersion
key instead.

Change-Id: Ie9aca05b88d5965ed1456396cc8ee763852fdee8

V3 api doesn't have this issue.

subject: Adds to Keystone to convert V2 endpoints to V3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 12:11:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/v3/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/0546e964fc7a4d6d099e23cf2f7cf6da2ca72d4e', 'message': 'Adds to Keystone to convert V2 endpoints to V3

The Domain Quota Management Driver uses the V3 Authentication Token.
Also, it tries to contact Keystone for getting list of projects in a
domain using V3 API like /v3/projects?domain_id=<id>. But the
keystone v3/client.py default uses V2 API and hence code changed
to convert V2 endpoints for V3 endpoints. This change is required
to implement blue print domain-quota-driver-api

Change-Id: Ib4f71e39bb541e31cfb16e95b59b05dd005bfb54
'}]
commit_message:
Adds to Keystone to convert V2 endpoints to V3

The Domain Quota Management Driver uses the V3 Authentication Token.
Also, it tries to contact Keystone for getting list of projects in a
domain using V3 API like /v3/projects?domain_id=<id>. But the
keystone v3/client.py default uses V2 API and hence code changed
to convert V2 endpoints for V3 endpoints. This change is required
to implement blue print domain-quota-driver-api

Change-Id: Ib4f71e39bb541e31cfb16e95b59b05dd005bfb54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/78/74678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding weight column to Neutron lb member list CLI

Adding 'weight' column to lbaas member-list command in order to quickly
identify member properties. Protocol port was already been shown.
This avoids having to enter each member details to see the weights
settings.

Change-Id: Id3c8cd8b3304535e2d82777018121007ed3bb129
Closes-Bug: #1267575

subject: Improve unit test coverage for Cisco plugin model code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-24 04:08:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ddd29f16a494d353bd8b3c879666fa4b3cc85bf0', 'message': 'Improve unit test coverage for Cisco plugin model code

Closes-Bug: #1190620

This fix improves unit test coverage for:

commit_message:
Improve unit test coverage for Cisco plugin model code

Closes-Bug: #1190620

This fix improves unit test coverage for:
quantum/plugins/cisco/models/virt_phy_sw_v2.py
Test coverage is improved from about 78% to 99%.

One change included in this fix is removal of some code in
the _invoke_plugin() method in virt_phy_sw_v2.py which looks
like it's attempting to handle the case where the number of
arguments being passed to _invoke_plugin() exceeds the number
of arguments expected for the target plugin method. This
section of code does not get executed for any existing
calls to _invoke_plugin(), and it doesn't appear that
this logic would work (except when the target plugin method
includes a **kwargs expansion).

Change-Id: Ibceb7a462a213f3ba693bcbe94e77d97b2e1440a

commit_message:
Bug fix on neutron's API to return the correct target ID

In the class FloatingIpManager, the function filters the
resulting list of ports with all available floating ips.
The function now returns the target ID of a port with a
floating IP associated to it. Added a new function to get
this to pass. In the next phase is to refactor the
floating ip api to allow a finer granularity. This will
be useful later for managing floating ips.

Change-Id: I02286dbbb60318b0157992622ffdeeae45a71bc1
Closes-Bug: 1265872

commit_message:
Add shared parameter for metering labels

With this patch metering labels can
be set as shared so that the rules
associated with this label will be
applied to all routers for all tenants.

Partially implements
blueprint l3-metering-mgnt-ext

Change-Id: I23f9fb9cf17c7a20069616bb1c4ae19a5dc55d68

commit_message:
Remove landscape in the ubuntu element

There is little point to have landscape installed in the images, since
it is unlikely they will be enrolled into Landscape, and even more
unlikely if they're a short lived VM.

Change-Id: I46904974fed2ee8b111fb54345d96676be016be0

The heat.engine.hot module is getting unruly; make it a package in

Change-Id: I72b9351cddf0591e7e9acf10f869fbfa2c8efd9a
'}]
commit_message:
Move HOT to a separate subpackage

The heat.engine.hot module is getting unruly; make it a package in
anticipation of splitting it up into separate modules.

commit_message:
unit tests: Refactor to accomodate lazy evaluation

Do a complete resolution of all functions on each snippet, rather than
specifying individual function resolution methods to call.

Change-Id: I63f8a53d8a573a2e30bd9a8d901811367a570240

commit_message:
Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Change-Id: Ie815e457c0b25ab828e780b5d90233ba0ceff61f
Closes-Bug: #1251026

commit_message:
Update help message of flag 'enable_isolated_metadata'

Thanks to the commit c73b54e50b62c489f04432bdbc5bee678b18226e,
the way of DHCP agent determines how a subnet is isolated evolves.
But the flag help message wasn't updtated accordingly to this evolution.

Change-Id: If07d8e0802524f9babdee0c8cc07d40cb0803afb
Closes-bug: #1269722

commit_message:
Add tests for create grant when no group

There were no tests that show what happens when you create a grant
(PUT /v3/projects/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id}
and /v3/domains/{domain_id}/...) for a group that doesn't exist.
The server returns a 404 Not Found for the group.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: Iafa051764b46158f2b1175b29c535f5d6fdc251d

commit_message:
Adds service request parameter filter for V3 API os-hosts request

Both V2 and V3 API do not support service request parameter filter
for os-hosts request. For V2 API, there is no need to having two
different clouds having different APIs (one with service filter
one without) but just take V2 API as a document bug. This patch
will only fix V3 API.

DocImpact
Adds the ability to filter a hosts list request by service for
the V3 API.

Change-Id: I42163707049300b0dee677558ed49280bcc7369d
Partial-Bug: #1224763

subject: NeutronResourcesTestJSON test reasons for stack failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 02:58:57.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/orchestration/stacks/test_neutron_resources.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/ee4c110d92ebbc0165cc3f90b4e72d78e56e1e77', 'message': 'NeutronResourcesTestJSON test reasons for stack failure

Currently no tests are run if the stack does not go to CREATE_COMPLETE
at the end of setUpClass. This hides the actual reason for the stack failure
which will be caused by one of the resources.  This change does the following:
- removes the assert stack CREATE_COMPLETE
- removes test_created_resources since each resource now waits for resource creation
- each test starts by waiting for the resource(s) it needs to go to CREATE_COMPLETE
- a test_wait_condition has been added, which logs the nova server console log
  on waitcondition timeout. This should help debug the reason for any failure.

This test is often failing and this change should help find the cause.

Change-Id: I57c358e5c14b39f299b94f0bf9306968d49c525d
'}]
commit_message:
NeutronResourcesTestJSON test reasons for stack failure

Currently no tests are run if the stack does not go to CREATE_COMPLETE
at the end of setUpClass. This hides the actual reason for the stack failure
which will be caused by one of the resources.  This change does the following:
- removes the assert stack CREATE_COMPLETE
- removes test_created_resources since each resource now waits for resource creation
- each test starts by waiting for the resource(s) it needs to go to CREATE_COMPLETE
- a test_wait_condition has been added, which logs the nova server console log
  on waitcondition timeout. This should help debug the reason for any failure.

This test is often failing and this change should help find the cause.

Change-Id: I57c358e5c14b39f299b94f0bf9306968d49c525d

commit_message:
Move X-Auth-Url logic to auth_url middleware

Refactoring the auth_password middleware to move X-Auth-Url logic
into the auth_url middleware, so that all X-Auth-Url logic is
handled in one place.

This also adds the auth_url middleware in front of the auth_password
middleware, so that there should be no behavior change

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: #1259364
Change-Id: I3819cbf1a4c4955752dc7c804b0add1bab2b962c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 15:56:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9e8d2eb339a45eb0428024ecce3082aa1a18009b', 'message': 'Fix invalid account acl generating 500 response.

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-19 18:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_acl.py', 'swift/common/middleware/acl.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/36adcb6c66bf0c0093ead1080078ca8154b0d158', 'message': "Fix invalid account acl generating 500 response.

header value that is valid json but not a valid ACL was
causing a 500 Internal Error if the value did not parse
to a dict due to an exception being raised in tempauth.py.

This patch modifies acl.py to check that the header value
is both json and parses to a dict. The existing
tests are extended to cover these invalid header values.

(e.g. '{ }') to be accepted as a value for
X-Account-Access-Control in the same way that '{}' is.

Closes-bug: 1281626

Change-Id: Ia06ba9c9d16f749f801a8158e73d3898c4a42888
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid account acl generating 500 response.

Sending an account POST with an X-Account-Access-Control
header value that is valid json but not a valid ACL was
causing a 500 Internal Error if the value did not parse
to a dict due to an exception being raised in tempauth.py.

This patch modifies acl.py to check that the header value
is both json and parses to a dict. The existing
tests are extended to cover these invalid header values.

This patch also enables json encoded dicts with whitespace
(e.g. '{ }') to be accepted as a value for
X-Account-Access-Control in the same way that '{}' is.
These previously resulted in a 400 response.

Closes-bug: 1281626

Change-Id: Ia06ba9c9d16f749f801a8158e73d3898c4a42888

commit_message:
Add task result graphic ploter command

$ rally task plot2html --task-id <uuid> [--out filename.html] [--open]

* Get results of task with <uuid>
* Process it
* Write results to filename.html if it is specified or
  to the <uuid>.html
* If --open is specified file with results will be opened
  in your web browser

In HTML file with results we have:
* Select box that allows to specify benchmark from task
* Dump of JSON config for this task
* Stacked area graphic with duration and idle_duration for every iteration
* Pie with ratio errors/success
* Stacked area graphic with duration of all actions
* Pie with ration between avarage time of actions

This is only first step. In future we should:
* Add results in text represenation (e.g. our CLI task detailed)
* Add raw results
* Add histogram graphic that will show probability / duration for duration and atomic
  actions.

bp data-processing

Change-Id: I1168c6c85816bb26ef1637a385c8ccc558d8d1d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/70/72970/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: fuelclient node --delete clears cluster too soon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-17 17:17:48.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/fuel'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/ee38fe098b0ad6400f751c7419f41d27090c7491', 'message': 'fuelclient node --delete clears cluster too soon

Remove "cluster_id": None so that only pending delete flag is set. This would
 cause nodes to be seperated from the cluster, but the astuste delete task wont
 run becase there are no changes to deploy.

This makes the CLI behave the same as the UI so that a delete is a two stage
 process.

Related-bug: #1281153
Related-bug: #1265036

Change-Id: I24bd79e622ecd18915a3b362868f842bcfa84121
'}]
commit_message:
fuelclient node --delete clears cluster too soon

Remove "cluster_id": None so that only pending delete flag is set. This would
 cause nodes to be seperated from the cluster, but the astuste delete task wont
 run becase there are no changes to deploy.

This makes the CLI behave the same as the UI so that a delete is a two stage
 process.

Related-bug: #1281153
Related-bug: #1265036

Change-Id: I24bd79e622ecd18915a3b362868f842bcfa84121
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/02/74102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
KDS fix documented exception.

The set_key method raises GroupStatusChanged when you try to
change the 'group' of an existing key.

commit_message:
Add tests for create grant when no user

There were no tests that show what happens when you create a grant
(PUT /v3/projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id} and
/v3/domains/{domain_id}/...) for a user that doesn't exist. The
server returns a 404 Not Found for the user.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: I8b6e9c6c667d523a645472a227c60d2d65fe8d57

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-11 07:41:36.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/08ee1b57de9f62813c11c3943105705e8bf5b9e0', 'message': "Rewrite RemoteClient.get_boot_time()

commit_message:
Rewrite RemoteClient.get_boot_time()

This is doing conversion between time formats, while we could really
just stay in seconds. This also fixes the method to work for cirros,
which doesn't know about human readable time formats.

Change-Id: Id123d71adb29d169a26f0dde6af00f292fe61d09
Closes-Bug: #1244823
(cherry picked from commit 3c0b5b90b5bd4e5f5ff9f66fb2919fc2c6f2a34d)

commit_message:
Ensure domains.list filtered results are correct

Convert enabled=False to enabled=0, such that requests directed to
an older keystone not containing the fix for bug #1267530 will not
return the wrong data.

Closes-Bug: #1281070
Change-Id: I49fd0953fc2323f2034c241c6342ced6f3412125

subject: stop putting setup_* into separate log files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 11:16:31.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/a986df5d55a28820a2ba6d68f4aeaefeaf9d3c37', 'message': "stop putting setup_* into separate log files

when things fail in setup_ (which they do) the content is hidden
in other logs, so the console level fail isn't clear. It also means
the failures aren't available in logstash, or even time indexed in
their own logs.

instead, leave their content in the main console.html so the flow
for these items can be easily seen.

Change-Id: I65e3b183e46f1cf22a6e750a3d03c00c1446ad45
"}]
commit_message:
stop putting setup_* into separate log files

when things fail in setup_ (which they do) the content is hidden
in other logs, so the console level fail isn't clear. It also means
the failures aren't available in logstash, or even time indexed in
their own logs.

instead, leave their content in the main console.html so the flow
for these items can be easily seen.

Change-Id: I65e3b183e46f1cf22a6e750a3d03c00c1446ad45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/31/74331/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove provider router configuration

To be compatible with the Icehouse release of MidoNet, the
provider router configuration is removed from devstack since
it is no longer necessary to configure it.

Change-Id: I4be2d9bbf2c82fd375702cbb1d60c3277086134f
Implements: blueprint remove-provider-router-config-for-midonet

subject: Extending quota support for neutron LBaaS entities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-29 07:43:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/61fa65023efe5ca5f225445fb6051ad226f97462', 'message': 'Extending quota support for neutron LBaaS entities

Note: This change is a continuation of abandoned
      change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58720/
      Previous change was abandoned due to rebase problem.

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for neutron project.
Another one is for python-neutronclient package,
another one for tempest,
and another one for horizon/openstack-dashboard project

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another two changes.

Change-Id: I64a1d3647a4eb21833266346377416638667a931
Implements: blueprint neutron-quota-extension

commit_message:
Extending quota support for neutron LBaaS entities

Note: This change is a continuation of abandoned
      change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58720/
      Previous change was abandoned due to rebase problem.

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for neutron project.
Another one is for python-neutronclient package,
another one for tempest,
and another one for horizon/openstack-dashboard project

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another two changes.

Change-Id: I64a1d3647a4eb21833266346377416638667a931
Implements: blueprint neutron-quota-extension

commit_message:
Preventing overlapping subnets in network scenarios

Connecting subnets with the same cidr to the some router,
is not too wise, and it might be prevented by neutron in
several configuration.

Change-Id: Ieb7da14be44a50b4324370b0193dd8590a3e4dac

commit_message:
Wrapper DBDuplicateEntry for flavor_extra_specs_update_or_create

It is not good to propagated and caught DuplicateEntry exception
outside of the db api flavor_extra_specs_update_or_create, this
patch was translate the DuplicateEntry exception to a more
specific one for this db api.

This requirement is get from review comments of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/66187/

Change-Id: I57f740797a0239e7183e6cf31023154a706dc6fb

commit_message:
Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urlparse

    To keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.urllib.parse
    to replace urlparse.

    Change-Id: I79cace809f34c7fdea078144320dcebce66673a1

commit_message:
Do not merge: Reproduce bug/1277027

The cause of bug/1277027 seems the race condition between "create
a server" and "delete a server".
This patch is for reproducing bug/1277027 easily.

commit_message:
Prevents livelock when retry_on_deadlock

A random interval is necessary to ensure the colliding
transactions don't continuously keep bumping into each other
without progress.

Closes-Bug: #1268891
Change-Id: I5a3601de2027e5cfa8dfbb8b4ad97d67f05e62a9

subject: Set stack_user_domain config correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 14:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['lib/heat'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/8e1a1ffdfbf59e01688fd2e6e007ab72d49263ed', 'message': 'Set stack_user_domain config correctly

The recently merged patch which creates a domain for heat
fails to correctly set the domain ID in heat.conf, so move the
setting of the config option to immediately after we create the
domain.  Also add the missing DEFAULT section identifier in the
iniset, and use OS_TOKEN instead of OS_SERVICE token, because
the stack.sh comment says this is exported for the openstackclient
workaround.

Change-Id: I912f774f1215d68cbcfe44229b371f318d92966a
Closes-Bug: #1283075
'}]
commit_message:
Set stack_user_domain config correctly

The recently merged patch which creates a domain for heat
fails to correctly set the domain ID in heat.conf, so move the
setting of the config option to immediately after we create the
domain.  Also add the missing DEFAULT section identifier in the
iniset, and use OS_TOKEN instead of OS_SERVICE token, because
the stack.sh comment says this is exported for the openstackclient
workaround.

Change-Id: I912f774f1215d68cbcfe44229b371f318d92966a
Closes-Bug: #1283075

commit_message:
Mark XML as deprecated in the v2 API

Log a warning the first time a server gets encoded as XML.
I didn't see an immediately obvious place to put this warning,
but anyone actually using XML will hit this code path, so it
seems fine to me.

Implements blueprint deprecate-xml-in-v2-api

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4acc15ce5f487738bb34a95c2261a5d05d827d8d

commit_message:
adjust version definition for v3 to be only json

the version definition for the v3 API still publicized xml as
a supported mime type. We should not do that.

Part of bp remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: Iba87b7ee05f0a89a3f7051d4fea8a91635d7778d

commit_message:
Treat port attachment failures correctly

Raise a more appropriate exception following the failure of a
port attachment.

Closes-bug: #1245683

Change-Id: I77e9568c8675b0dd6a0c8c741e71e936ed3998a1

commit_message:
Update Nova to allow using either Glance V1 or V2 API

Refactor the images layer and introduce the ability to select
between V1 or V2 Glance API.

Implements: bp use-glance-v2-api

Change-Id: Ie39cb541139e2bc65d844e17363cb1dc1fa3791e

commit_message:
Remove dependent module py3kcompat

Module py3kcompat was removed from oslo-incubator, we can use
six directly.

+Sync db & db.sqlalchemy from olso in order to sync commit of
 removing py3kcompat from oslo

Change-Id: I4df409db46987014743b320570b9a8c251d7645a
Closes-Bug: #1280033

commit_message:
Remove old driver mapping deprecation

This deprecation was introduced back in Grizzly, which will be EOL after
IceHouse. Removing to clean things up.

Change-Id: I509bb4115c3c88a7af7326125feb760f20847b8d

commit_message:
Rally & Tempest integration (base) - part 2

Add ability to specify sets of tempest tests and regexps for tests.

Usage:
rally verify start --deploy-id=<deploy_id> --set=<set_name> --regex=<regex>

Available sets: smoke (by default), full, baremetal, compute, data_processing,
identity, image, network, object_storage, orchestration, telemetry, volume.

Change-Id: Icc9cb24e3feeb4ad6f80b311cf30bc2cf5ba9c65
Related: blueprint tempest-verification

commit_message:
Fix the indents of v3 API sample docs

There are some indent typos in v3 API sample docs.
Most API samples' indents are 4 spaces, but some samples' indents
are 2 spaces. This patch fixes them.

These typos have been found during the work for auto-generating API
API sample docs from API validation schemas. The auto-generator'll
output API sample docs with json.dumps() method and that would make
the difference between current docs which are fixed with this patch
because the generator would make API samples consistent.
This patch's purpose is also for preparing the generator.

Change-Id: Ieb6e587fcf4c01c128199950db93e1087bc43f41

commit_message:
Remove db layer admin authorization on services

Remove db layer admin authorization on services, splits the policy
for services by action and adds policy test cases for hypervisors on V3 API.

UpgradeImpact: there is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for compute_extension:services is the
only restriction, if the default rule changed for
'compute_extension:services', need upgrade to
"compute_extension:services": "rule:admin_api" at least

Change-Id: I41f760699ada5bd39f3592ecc569879bdc0d0c50
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

commit_message:
Remove db layer admin authorization on compute_node

Remove db layer admin authorization on compute_node, added policy test
cases for hypervisors on V3 API.

UpgradeImpact: there is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for compute_extension:hypervisors is the
only restriction, if the default rule changed for
'compute_extension:hypervisors', need upgrade to
"compute_extension:hypervisors": "rule:admin_api" at least

Change-Id: I51001b85b47915646624bd22220f5a0766d74c41
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

commit_message:
Move policy check of get_vnc_console/get_spice_console to api layer

This patch moves "compute:get_vnc_console/get_spice_console" to api layer
nova api v2, and uses "compute_extension:v3:os-remote-consoles:
get_vnc_console/get_spice_console" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api and make related tests for it

Change-Id: I671b069da6a11307e9971f3017f7791b3a498744
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

commit_message:
Move policy check of restore to api layer

This patch moves "compute:restore" to api layer nova api v2,
and uses "compute_extension:v3:os-deferred-delete:restore"
for nova api v3. Also removes policy check from compute
api and make related tests for it

Change-Id: Ife71be048146d83e39943c936e54f30fc65f3109
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

commit_message:
Require testrepository>=0.0.18

To help with debugging, quoting from upstream:

 `run` now accepts `--isolated` as a parameter, which will cause
 each selected test to be run independently. This can be useful
 to both workaround isolation bugs and detect tests that can
 not be run independently.

Change-Id: I168700457566067cc7389d290a2d7ef4e87ba8a2

subject: Fix invalid facilities documented in rootwrap.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 01:52:15.000000000', 'files': ['etc/rootwrap.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a5a8e2db49aa1a12ffc968fb23913f7eeade69a3', 'message': 'Fix invalid facilities documented in rootwrap.conf

The values user0 and user1 do not map to valid facility values.
local1, etc.  Using user0 results in a  pri value that does not map
back to a facility of the same name in syslog.

RFC5424 suggest values values of local0 through local7.  Setting
syslog_log_facility to one of those values results in a message with a
priority that can be mapped back to the original string value.

This fix adjusts the comment in rootwrap.conf to suggest the local
prefix instead of the user prefix.

Change-Id: I835ad17c817b8623e382368b39b06944470be480
Closes-bug: #1280879
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid facilities documented in rootwrap.conf

The values user0 and user1 do not map to valid facility values.
local1, etc.  Using user0 results in a  pri value that does not map
back to a facility of the same name in syslog.

RFC5424 suggest values values of local0 through local7.  Setting
syslog_log_facility to one of those values results in a message with a
priority that can be mapped back to the original string value.

This fix adjusts the comment in rootwrap.conf to suggest the local
prefix instead of the user prefix.

Change-Id: I835ad17c817b8623e382368b39b06944470be480
Closes-bug: #1280879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/74220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
ipt_mgr.ipv6 written in the wrong ipt_mgr.ipv4

This patch fixes the issue of writing the wrong firewall rule where an IP6
rule is written to IP4.

Closes-Bug:#1263877

commit_message:
ML2/vxlan/test: remove unnecessary self.addCleanup(cfg.CONF.reset)

This patch is follow up of change set of
4808f91eb2c245344517fc89c37c6c4c88e9051b bug/1260262 review/61694.
The change set adds unnecessary self.addCleanup(cfg.CONF.reset) to
VxlanTypeMultiRangeTest as pointed out. This patch Remove the line.

Change-Id: Ia6ce4bc346cf6320ba556e80689dadb7d84e5ee8

After no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler, host_ip was stored to the table
of compute_nodes. Host ip address should be considered as the hypervisor
attribute similar as hypervisor_type, hypervisor_version etc, and now
those attributes such as hypervisor_type, hypervisor_version etc are all
listed as the hypervisor attribute when call "nova hypervisor-show host",
so we can also set "host_ip" as a new attribute output for this command.

DocImpact
 1) Only administrators can view hypervisor detail in nova.
 2) It can help improve debug ability for nova. For example, if admin
    using SimpleCIDRAffinityFilter, then after VM deployed, admin can
    check if the VM was deployed successfully to the desired host by
    checking ip address of the host via "nova hypervisor-show host".
 3) Add host_ip to the output for "nova hypervisor-show"

Implement bp hypervisor-show-ip
Change-Id: I006a504d030be1f47beb68a844647026a6daf0ce
