commit_message:
Adds host_ip to hypervisor show API

After no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler, host_ip was stored in the table
of compute_nodes. Host ip address should be considered as the hypervisor
attribute similar to the hypervisor_type, hypervisor_version etc, and
now those attributes such as hypervisor_type, hypervisor_version etc
are all listed as the hypervisor attribute when calling "nova
hypervisor-show host", so we can also set "host_ip" as a new attribute
output for this command.

DocImpact
1) Only administrators can view hypervisor detail in nova.
2) It can help improve debug capabilities for nova. For example, if
admin using SimpleCIDRAffinityFilter, then after VM is deployed, admin
can check if the VM was deployed successfully to the desired host by
checking ip address of the host via "nova hypervisor-show host".
3) Add host_ip to the output for "nova hypervisor-show"

Implement bp hypervisor-show-ip
Change-Id: I006a504d030be1f47beb68a844647026a6daf0ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/52733/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Remove ovs_use_veth from cloud-admin-guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 15:32:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud/section_networking_introduction.xml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/138abc079eff8e6497cb4f416783a3cfccddc32e', 'message': "Remove ovs_use_veth from cloud-admin-guide

Remove direction to set ovs_use_veth to true from cloud-admin-guide.
It's not required for recent kernels, and for those who aren't using
recent kernels we catch it in the install guide.

As this guide came into being after all supporting distributions had
moved to provide namespaces support I do not think we need to cater to
that situation here.

Change-Id: Ie0fa23bfdfcc3454988ead175ef0388f6a0602ba
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ovs_use_veth from cloud-admin-guide

Remove direction to set ovs_use_veth to true from cloud-admin-guide.
It's not required for recent kernels, and for those who aren't using
recent kernels we catch it in the install guide.

As this guide came into being after all supporting distributions had
moved to provide namespaces support I do not think we need to cater to
that situation here.

Change-Id: Ie0fa23bfdfcc3454988ead175ef0388f6a0602ba

commit_message:
Remove dependent module py3kcompat

Module py3kcompat was removed from oslo-incubator, we can use
six directly.

* Sync commit of removing py3kcompat from oslo
* use six replace usage of py3kcompat

Change-Id: Ifc9be2cc36c93d298402bd430be35b541c9b7eba
Closes-Bug: #1280033

commit_message:
Implements an LBaaS driver for NetScaler devices

This driver for the Neutron LBaaS plugin allows for
using the Citrix NetScaler loadbalancing devices
to provide Neutron LBaaS functionality in OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ibfeb54c4402943fb3696a1c599fa373e42e520d4
Implements: blueprint netscaler-lbaas-driver

commit_message:
Use six.StringIO/BytesIO instead of StringIO.StringIO

to keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.StringIO/BytesIO to
replace StringIO.StringIO

StringIO works for unicode
BytesIO works for bytes

Closes-Bug: #1280100

commit_message:
Ensure that session is rolled back on bulk creates

During bulk creates, the session is began explicitely;
ensure that it gets rolled back before re-raising in
order to avoid triggering InvalidRequestError
exceptions when the session is reused.

Partial-bug: 1244757

Change-Id: I797faeec2ca5374620db905599ab6e6f04fdcabd

subject: Add error as not-in-progress migration status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-15 01:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/aee651c51ec344efb7b26f98628eacbcdc62f0d9', 'message': 'Add error as not-in-progress migration status

When a migration status becomes "error" the migration is no longer
in progress, i.e. it is in a terminal state.  However, the
migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node method returns migrations
that have an "error" status, causing, among other things, the
Resource Tracker to continually log messages about how an
Instance is not resizing, creating excessive noise in the logs,
especially since the fact that a migration is entering the "error"
status is already logged.  This change causes "error"-status
migrations to not be included when retrieving "in progress"
migrations.

Closes-Bug: #1258275

Change-Id: I67bfec9f91f89ff38422469a5d86e14c4fffa40b
(cherry picked from commit 16dfff5dedffcf4645df3c13b623d1ecd7560d8b)
'}]
commit_message:
Add error as not-in-progress migration status

When a migration status becomes "error" the migration is no longer
in progress, i.e. it is in a terminal state.  However, the
migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node method returns migrations
that have an "error" status, causing, among other things, the
Resource Tracker to continually log messages about how an
Instance is not resizing, creating excessive noise in the logs,
especially since the fact that a migration is entering the "error"
status is already logged.  This change causes "error"-status
migrations to not be included when retrieving "in progress"
migrations.

Closes-Bug: #1258275

Change-Id: I67bfec9f91f89ff38422469a5d86e14c4fffa40b
(cherry picked from commit 16dfff5dedffcf4645df3c13b623d1ecd7560d8b)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-15 08:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/storage_users.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cb4ceb68a471146a1434fc7121f229a97b80b0e5', 'message': "Capture exception for JSON load in virt.storage_users

"}]
commit_message:
Capture exception for JSON load in virt.storage_users

If CONF.instances_path/compute_nodes is empty when the storage_users
tries to register the storage use (virt.storage_users.register_storage_use)
the exception is uncaught and raised. As a consequence, the image cache
manager won't run.

Closes-Bug: #1252659

Change-Id: If9ed5e75b0bc0b8f3a7c5fd7ec88f6399e4e59c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/73792/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix misspellings in devstack gate

Fix misspellings detected by:
* pip install misspellings
* git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Change-Id: Ib63929e6e7c01f4c422edef9bad421b1252609a3
Closes-Bug: #1257295

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-11 15:54:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9561264c108c71ebaed95e1aebaaecd0f1963b39', 'message': "Fix get versions call in verify_nova_api_versions()

This commit fixes the HTTP GET call to return the list of nova api
versions. The enpoint that the tempest clients use for servers
includes the api version. This is because nova registers each version
api as separate endpoints in keystone's catalog. So this commit fixes
the url to use the unversioned endpoint so the list of versions will
be returned.

Change-Id: Iaf4671d4d1dd285161aa5679648956c086a9119c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-18 20:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['tools/verify_tempest_config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a508081055e35219f8d217cb0e9a5ca0ef90a3e3', 'message': "Fix get versions call in verify_nova_api_versions()

This commit fixes the HTTP GET call to return the list of nova api
versions. The enpoint that the tempest clients use for servers
includes the api version. This is because nova registers each version
api as separate endpoints in keystone's catalog. So this commit fixes
the url to use the unversioned endpoint so the list of versions will
be returned.

Change-Id: Iaf4671d4d1dd285161aa5679648956c086a9119c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get versions call in verify_nova_api_versions()

This commit fixes the HTTP GET call to return the list of nova api
versions. The enpoint that the tempest clients use for servers
includes the api version. This is because nova registers each version
api as separate endpoints in keystone's catalog. So this commit fixes
the url to use the unversioned endpoint so the list of versions will
be returned.

Change-Id: Iaf4671d4d1dd285161aa5679648956c086a9119c

commit_message:
NSX: get_port_status passed wrong id for network

The call to get_port_status in update_port was passing in the neutron
network_id instead of the nsx_network_id. These used to be the same
but now are different. This patch updates the code so that it now
passes in the correct uuid.

Change-Id: I7b0bd617f68291fa457a49e52d595bb8de1d4835
Closes-bug: #1281789
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/07/74507/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Don't be too strict for vlan_ranges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 13:28:18.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/parser/functions/validate_network_vlan_ranges.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/8fd57075d13e7c4e84e66378e2490eb02f3a00c1', 'message': "Don't be too strict for vlan_ranges

VLAN range can be also in format of physical network or with only
single ID. This patch makes those values pass the validation

For more info please check https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1066549

Change-Id: I054fbd45ac2228a3a579c08cdd617d970abcaddf
"}]
commit_message:
Don't be too strict for vlan_ranges

VLAN range can be also in format of physical network or with only
single ID. This patch makes those values pass the validation

For more info please check https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1066549

Change-Id: I054fbd45ac2228a3a579c08cdd617d970abcaddf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/09/74709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Do not enforce glance_control_exchange
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-28 23:20:58.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_init_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer/commit/85d46894cca6ba80e8cb57243dde57e44cffa443', 'message': "Do not enforce glance_control_exchange

The default glance_control_exchange in Ceilometer has been changed
from 'glance_notifications' to 'glance' in grizzly-2. Glance always
had 'glance' for its control_exchange.

This was a bug in Ceilometer and puppet-ceilometer patched it.
It shouldn't anymore.

Change-Id: I217515c91f092fb3e8039dde2d14a7ab4cbb7245
Closes-bug: #1273878
"}]
commit_message:
Do not enforce glance_control_exchange

The default glance_control_exchange in Ceilometer has been changed
from 'glance_notifications' to 'glance' in grizzly-2. Glance always
had 'glance' for its control_exchange.

This was a bug in Ceilometer and puppet-ceilometer patched it.
It shouldn't anymore.

Change-Id: I217515c91f092fb3e8039dde2d14a7ab4cbb7245
Closes-bug: #1273878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/46/69746/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Nova compute v3 APIs

Created xml pages to hold the v3 compute API extensions.
xml files link to several different wadls, which in turn,
call several api samples. This is not a complete listing,
but it is a start. Will be adding others as they become available.

Closes-Bug: #1274616
Closes-Bug: #1197419
Closes-Bug: #1203653

Change-Id: Ie6d18336b46c262ce3918a9e37238f7403c75eb6

commit_message:
Remove install_venv_common module

It recently came to light (at least to me) the venv scripts in
oslo-incubator.git are not the recommended way of creating a
virtual environment. With that in mind we remove it from cookiecutter.

Change-Id: I4f234e0d333cf42dbe0eaa76d54d3367e0dfec2a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>

commit_message:
Reset API naming scheme for VMware NSX plugin

Introduce new naming scheme, whilst preserving
backward compatibility for the extensions affected.

Deprecated extensions will be removed from Juno.

Partial-implements blueprint: nicira-plugin-renaming

Change-Id: Icd68e5db04aa008ac31994ae0cb5c1b7f2551303

Add qcow2 image support

This commit adds qcow2 image format for some scenario test. Because
qcow2 disk image format is nicer than uec format.

Change-Id: I4c812176ed1800052c3192110067b1ae7fb04b85

subject: Fix method get_versions in rest_client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 14:34:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f3bd879eb0cae3e8de8dd5170e9d217409095fa7', 'message': 'Fix method get_versions in rest_client

In rest_client's "get_versions" method is used "_parse_resp" method,
that removes top-key of dict or top element of xml tree.
But this top key is used in this method for selection.

Change-Id: I846ff53b309d9aa1e5f84a16c6a6f97e6b1d7818
Closes-Bug: #1282112
'}]
commit_message:
Fix method get_versions in rest_client

In rest_client's "get_versions" method is used "_parse_resp" method,
that removes top-key of dict or top element of xml tree.
But this top key is used in this method for selection.

Change-Id: I846ff53b309d9aa1e5f84a16c6a6f97e6b1d7818
Closes-Bug: #1282112
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/74733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix get_versions string parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 20:54:14.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9f334c3cd22853b10ad6fda0fe95ff5dfe37e633', 'message': "Fix get_versions string parsing

During the recent rest client refactor the _parse_resp() method was
improved to detect whether there was a single key at the top level
and drop it if there was. However the get_versions() method wasn't
updated at the same time, this led to the 'versions' being
referenced when it was removed from the resp dict. This commit fixes
this by removing the reference to versions.

Change-Id: I92003bd3f8c63a61a0d078d141e86dea4115bb80
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get_versions string parsing

During the recent rest client refactor the _parse_resp() method was
improved to detect whether there was a single key at the top level
and drop it if there was. However the get_versions() method wasn't
updated at the same time, this led to the 'versions' being
referenced when it was removed from the resp dict. This commit fixes
this by removing the reference to versions.

Change-Id: I92003bd3f8c63a61a0d078d141e86dea4115bb80

commit_message:
Introduce T106 rule for vi modelines

We don't need to have the vi modelines in each source file anymore.
We've already fixed them several times.
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/66507/
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/68552/
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69318/
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70133/
However, newly some files still have it in its header. So we should
check it automatically with our HACKING rule.
This commit introduces T106 rule for that.

Note: This code is copied from Nova's hacking rule.
   Change-Id: I347307a5145b2760c69085b6ca850d6a9137ffc6

Change-Id: I5c94ef041a39c2377ba6321ace8934f324287bcf
Closes-Bug: #1229324

commit_message:
Skip test_list_server_addresses if neutron until bug 1210483 is fixed

There is a known set of race conditions in nova when spawning instances
and setting up networking with neutron which is being addressed with
nova blueprint check-neutron-port-status, but until that's fixed in nova
we should skip the tests if you're using neutron.

Related-Bug: #1210483
Related blueprint check-neutron-port-status

Change-Id: I1661303a043b3add5eb6569f71ebccfae2b0ef68

commit_message:
Refactor cross_tenant to security_groups_basic_ops

Name is more appropriate.

Also - decouple cross_tenant from in-tenant test
With some cosmetic changes to the code.

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-advanced-scenarios

Change-Id: If7cb1f093172ae4f480e4a408c7f128061ca1ba6

commit_message:
stop throwing deprecation warnings on init

We are directly subclassing object, which takes no args on __init__,
and indeed need not have __init__.  If we decide to, for some reason, add a
parent class to this method we might want to add this back, but we won't so we
don't need to care about that.

Change-Id: If58885515b9ae5c682d743dba8e4dfe6c9a5d1d9

mention it.

commit_message:
Fix assertEqual parameter order post V3 API admin-actions-split

Post admin-actions-split cleanup to fix the order of parameters
in assertEqual tests for the testcases split out during the
bp v3-api-admin-actions-split.

Was originally part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73724 but
was split out into a separate patch at the request of a reviewer.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-admin-actions-split

commit_message:
Fix the instance_usage_audit_log path for admin privilege

Current instance_usage_audit_log path of policy.json is wrong, and
non-admin users can get instance_usage_audit_log.
This patch fixes the admin privilege problem.

Change-Id: Idf9fa6d500c36754ff38f414e03ca37a9b98680c
Closes-Bug: #1281911

commit_message:
api: Adds compute system load averages

following the spec:
   https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova_Compute_Load_Averages

Change-Id: Iff1381fc3cd9113e98f63e73ed1ddb981140b2de
Implements: blueprint compute-loadavg

commit_message:
Add a new compute API method for deleting retired services

Services and related compute nodes cannot currently be deleted
from the command-line.  If a node is retired, the service list
will continue to show the retired services.

A delete service REST method has been added to the compute
APIs to support the command-line removal of retired services.

Blueprint: remove-nova-compute
Change-Id: I655a7f818bb59c8971feb5841feeefafc3a4580a
Flags: DocImpact

subject: Sync log.py from oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-13 16:01:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/21d67dfde4336afdff014fc53a624ad96fb6f42a', 'message': 'Sync log.py from oslo

To honor RFC5424 add use_syslog_rfc_format config option
(default False, would be deprecated in J after existing
syslog format deprecation) which adds APP-NAME to syslog message
before MSG part to reflect application or service name.
Usable only with use_syslog, otherwise ignored.

During J, the default logging format for syslog should be changed
to always provide APP-NAME, thus use_syslog_rfc_format could be
deprecated in J as well.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6018c7322314a4b57052be1ec0fc5fa437069f44
Closes-bug: 904307
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-14 08:06:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/17c91d43bc81c6e09f3885fb17a44fdcac6f6e6f', 'message': 'Sync log.py from oslo

This change syncs log.py from oslo-incubator with commit
79e8a9a08daf563aa8a8d9280c9a6a27dcafc8f2

To honor RFC5424 add use_syslog_rfc_format config option
(default False, would be deprecated in J after existing
syslog format deprecation) which adds APP-NAME to syslog message
before MSG part to reflect application or service name.
Usable only with use_syslog, otherwise ignored.

During J, the default logging format for syslog should be changed

Closes-bug: 904307

This change syncs log.py from oslo-incubator with commit
79e8a9a08daf563aa8a8d9280c9a6a27dcafc8f2

To honor RFC5424 add use_syslog_rfc_format config option
(default False, would be deprecated in J after existing
syslog format deprecation) which adds APP-NAME to syslog message
before MSG part to reflect application or service name.
Usable only with use_syslog, otherwise ignored.

During J, the default logging format for syslog should be changed
to always provide APP-NAME, thus use_syslog_rfc_format could be
deprecated in J as well.

Since the rootwrap code was graduating to a separate library,
so the rootwrap related change should just go into oslo.rootwrap
and when oslo.rootwrap is released, nova will pull in the library.

Change-Id: I6018c7322314a4b57052be1ec0fc5fa437069f44
Closes-bug: 904307
'}]
commit_message:
Sync log.py from oslo

This change syncs log.py from oslo-incubator with commit
79e8a9a08daf563aa8a8d9280c9a6a27dcafc8f2

To honor RFC5424 add use_syslog_rfc_format config option
(default False, would be deprecated in J after existing
syslog format deprecation) which adds APP-NAME to syslog message
before MSG part to reflect application or service name.
Usable only with use_syslog, otherwise ignored.

During J, the default logging format for syslog should be changed
to always provide APP-NAME, thus use_syslog_rfc_format could be
deprecated in J as well.

Since the rootwrap code was graduating to a separate library,
so the rootwrap related change should just go into oslo.rootwrap
and when oslo.rootwrap is released, nova will pull in the library.

Change-Id: I6018c7322314a4b57052be1ec0fc5fa437069f44
Closes-bug: 904307

are no longer relevant.

commit_message:
Restore heat tests running with admin user, demo tenant

heat currently needs an admin user so that stacks can create users
however the tests need the demo tenant so that the neutron
private network is the default.

There is now a comment which explains the situation so that this
isn't changed again.

Change-Id: Ifd91d2a5af40e9697b51c3d48b13220d358cbcd8
Closes-Bug: #1281768

commit_message:
Prepare for enabling H302 (identity,volume,etc.)

We can use H302 rule but ignore it now. This commit prepares for
enabling H302 rule. But this commit modifies tempest/api/{identity,
orchestration, volume, utils} only and excludes some violations[1]
because if we fix all of them at one time, it's hard to merge this
commit.

[1]
 tempest.test.attr
 tempest.common.rest_client.RestClient
 tempest.common.rest_client.RestClientXML
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.xml_to_json
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.Element
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.Document
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.Text
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.XMLNS_11
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.XMLNS_V3
 tempest/clients.py

Change-Id: I811144df35a5a4d9a256cfaba1dcd28bbfbccb27

commit_message:
Adds cinder backup functional tests

Adds new tests to cover cinder backup api as well as the needed
json clients.

xml client will be submitted after bug #1270589 is fixed.

Change-Id: I8d40c58eaf0ccd24abf55a212f1177e61ef0a281
Closes-Bug: 1221335

commit_message:
Splits network_basic_ops to fully isolated test cases

Splits network basic ops to smaller test cases sharing code while tests
pass.
Due to network_basic_ops getting too complicated for its name

Test cases are fully isolated. No resource sharing.

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-advanced-scenarios

Change-Id: I1939f743b0335181e95924c2c5cb0bb259ae720e

subject: EC2 client token is not reuseable for new instance creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 12:26:36.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/thirdparty/boto/test_ec2_instance_run.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d9f9e00585338e5a1476bc9ecc9d3e7ee7a9a46a', 'message': 'EC2 client token is not reuseable for new instance creation

According to the Amazon documentation the the token is not reuseable
 for NEW instance creation at least for 24h.
Removing the new instance creation part from the
 test_run_idempotent_instances.

This change will allow as to fix/workaround the ec2 image bundling issue
 at devstack/euca2ools/boto side.

Change-Id: Id6eeeac303a31d69060ca454a5e224405229a39e
'}]
commit_message:
EC2 client token is not reuseable for new instance creation

According to the Amazon documentation the the token is not reuseable
 for NEW instance creation at least for 24h.
Removing the new instance creation part from the
 test_run_idempotent_instances.

This change will allow as to fix/workaround the ec2 image bundling issue
 at devstack/euca2ools/boto side.

Change-Id: Id6eeeac303a31d69060ca454a5e224405229a39e

subject: VMware: optimize instance reference access
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-05 14:57:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/20baef2c59728df7bb3e1af23db4f595e01eb996', 'message': "VMware: fix bug causing nova-compute CPU to spike to 100%

When there are hundreds of VMs running each time a VM is referenced
all of the VM's in the system will be read by nova-compute and then
filtered according to the UUID.

This is addressed by using an API (FindAllByUuid) which reads only
the specific VM. When a VM is created the config spec will be updated
with the UUID of the VM - that is, the field 'instanceUuid' will be
set. The search is later done on this field.

If the search fails then the old code will be invoked - this ensures
backward compatibility with running VM's.

(WIP - currently adding unit tests)

Change-Id: I00d6c29f46b06d082cf3af0369a69147a3376341
Closes-bug: #1258179
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-05 16:40:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/466b8bdf86d9fff6ccf043c94c50fdc7552c8b1d', 'message': "VMware: fix bug causing nova-compute CPU to spike to 100%

When there are hundreds of VMs running each time a VM is referenced
all of the VM's in the system will be read by nova-compute and then
filtered according to the UUID.

This is addressed by using an API (FindAllByUuid) which reads only
the specific VM. When a VM is created the config spec will be updated
with the UUID of the VM - that is, the field 'instanceUuid' will be
set. The search is later done on this field.

If the search fails then the old code will be invoked - this ensures
backward compatibility with running VM's.

Change-Id: I00d6c29f46b06d082cf3af0369a69147a3376341
Closes-bug: #1258179
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-06 12:32:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/71a31651227e25898baed987ac989b87b1fc5b7c', 'message': "VMware: fix bug causing nova-compute CPU to spike to 100%

When there are hundreds of VMs running each time a VM is referenced
all of the VM's in the system will be read by nova-compute and then
filtered according to the UUID.

This is addressed by using an API (FindAllByUuid) which reads only
the specific VM. When a VM is created the config spec will be updated
with the UUID of the VM - that is, the field 'instanceUuid' will be
set. The search is later done on this field.

If the search fails then the old code will be invoked - this ensures
backward compatibility with running VM's.

In addition to optimizing the search we also cache the VM reference.
This ensures that additional calls for the specific VM do not need
to query the backend for the reference.

Change-Id: I00d6c29f46b06d082cf3af0369a69147a3376341
Closes-bug: #1258179

"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2014-01-23 14:30:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4bf09635b55958f30dc36a1d4e772b4ad595ee74', 'message': "VMware: fix bug causing nova-compute CPU to spike to 100%

When there are hundreds of VMs running each time a VM is referenced
all of the VMs in the system will be read by nova-compute and then
filtered according to the UUID.

This is addressed by using an API (FindAllByUuid) which reads only
the specific VM. When a VM is created the config spec will be updated
with the UUID of the VM - that is, the field 'instanceUuid' will be
set. The search is later done on this field.

If the search fails then the old code will be invoked - this ensures
backward compatibility with running VM's.

In addition to optimizing the search we also cache the VM reference.
This ensures that additional calls for the specific VM do not need
to query the backend for the reference.

Change-Id: I00d6c29f46b06d082cf3af0369a69147a3376341
Closes-bug: #1258179

commit_message:
VMware: optimize instance reference access

Fix bug causing nova-compute CPU to spike to 100%.

When there are hundreds of VMs running each time a VM is referenced
all of the VMs in the system will be read by nova-compute and then
filtered according to the UUID.

This is addressed by using an API (FindAllByUuid) which reads only
the specific VM. When a VM is created the config spec will be updated
with the UUID of the VM - that is, the field 'instanceUuid' will be
set. The search is later done on this field.

If the search fails then the old code will be invoked - this ensures
backward compatibility with running VM's. Thus all VM's created
without the 'instanceUuid' set will not be affected.

In addition to optimizing the search we also cache the VM reference.
This ensures that additional calls for the specific VM do not need
to query the backend for the reference.

Change-Id: I00d6c29f46b06d082cf3af0369a69147a3376341
Closes-bug: #1258179

commit_message:
Fix instance_get_all_by_host to actually use slave

This was not fully plumbed out in the original commit,
thus any calls to this method were not actually making
it to a slave.

Original commit: 62e9829c19e099e3a10b2b54954163b5e780363b

Change-Id: If5b807ff9b6801e6038501220e7b6a42bb6132dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/07/75507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Periodic task poll_bandwidth_usage can use slave
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 22:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/43483ffed4183b3502306c2782bef5aa89ca0f56', 'message': "Periodic task poll_bandwidth_usage can use slave

Host instance lists will be retrieved from a slave
if the deployment has one configured. If no slave
 is configured behavoir remains the same.

There is still some more slaveification that can be
done with the bw_usage_cache queries. I've made notes
and also made a few changes to the db_api so that these
can be used when we get the necesssary bw_usage_cache
object created.

Change-Id: I4286f545573bf81cb036c29d48afa39a14cfad61
Partially-implments: bp-periodic-tasks-to-slave
"}]
commit_message:
Periodic task poll_bandwidth_usage can use slave

Host instance lists will be retrieved from a slave
if the deployment has one configured. If no slave
 is configured behavoir remains the same.

There is still some more slaveification that can be
done with the bw_usage_cache queries. I've made notes
and also made a few changes to the db_api so that these
can be used when we get the necesssary bw_usage_cache
object created.

Change-Id: I4286f545573bf81cb036c29d48afa39a14cfad61
Partially-implments: bp-periodic-tasks-to-slave
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/75524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Partially revert "XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 10:59:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c541f5439b5fe4c930b28765351c11c0fc317fad', 'message': 'Partially revert "XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing"

This partially reverts commit 270d4f1d6b100c802a65b31d35e406528aa7fd27.

The plugin has been left so the plugin version is not made incompatible
by removing a call, but the call to it from vm_utils has been removed.

I expect this call will be re-introduced in future when we have identified
the cause of the race condition and the appropriate usage.

The original fix was made to fix bug 1258169 where the number of attempts
made were not sufficient, so this revert does not reduce the number of
attempts.

Change-Id: I473b81b9970990b877d1886bb28a96888cc05f98
Closes-bug: 1282822
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-21 11:02:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/15896bf711c53b684f09ca27ea2e81c1db378951', 'message': 'Partially revert "XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing"

commit_message:
Partially revert "XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing"

This partially reverts commit 270d4f1d6b100c802a65b31d35e406528aa7fd27.

The plugin has been left so the plugin version is not made incompatible
by removing a call, but the call to it from vm_utils has been removed.

I expect this call will be re-introduced in future when we have identified
the cause of the race condition and the appropriate usage.

The original fix was made to fix bug 1258169 where the number of attempts
made were not sufficient, so this revert does not reduce the number of
attempts.

Change-Id: I473b81b9970990b877d1886bb28a96888cc05f98
Closes-bug: 1282822

commit_message:
Remove unused notifier and rpc modules from oslo sync

As part of the move to oslo.messaging (1a91aacb85922f8d74733979691f0bf26249debc)
we stopped using oslo-incubator's notifier and rpc, but openstack-common.conf
wasn't updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I11e17313afa0327ba4620dd8f08ecf379efef9ac

commit_message:
Add experimental warning for Cells

When we merged Cells a while back, we noted that the usage was
experimental but haven't had a good channel for communicating the
continued state to the user. Since we're adding warning messages
to virt drivers, this patch adds one for Cells as well, in the
Manager's init method.

Change-Id: I75b0bedf57250e7701b00f9ce0f60e4775eacfd7

commit_message:
Disable tempest backup tests if c-bak unavailable

This will update the tempest config to not run the cinder backup
tests when the c-bak service is not enabled.

Change-Id: I0b6486f1222afa7ae9bd9d13c7d3648d2b870710

commit_message:
Define $user referenced in db.pp

In db.pp, in the exec 'ceilometer dbsync' ressource the user
is supposed to be $::ceilometer::params::user, but it was
not defined.

Change-Id: I812b6ba2877faddfce86d3c97b95772b0d22d368
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/59/75059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Refactor driver BDM attach() to cover all uses
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-23 21:06:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/18241f20e3b8544512b9887dfcaddc44c7519df8', 'message': 'Allow driver BDM attach() to skip attached check

Add a separate flag to allow the execution to skip the
volume_api.check_attach step.

Check attach should always be done in the API, followed immediately by a
reservation, to minimize the chance of a race. However currently we
do the check_attach step on the compute side during boot, so it needs to
stay. Other operations like attach_volume will have it reserved causing
this check to fail on the compute side, so we lay down the groundwork to
be able to skip it when calling attach().

Part of blueprint: use-new-bdm-format-in-attach

Change-Id: Iff3890e39a8c75b1693df0918084ecf4492c4e91
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-02 09:30:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/723ad5c9cb156a00ca7bcb9eb6500f9746b79bf0', 'message': 'Allow driver BDM attach() to skip attached check

Add a separate flag to allow the execution to skip the
volume_api.check_attach step.

Check attach should always be done in the API, followed immediately by a
reservation, to minimize the chance of a race. However currently we
do the check_attach step on the compute side during boot, so it needs to
stay. Other operations like attach_volume will have it reserved causing
this check to fail on the compute side, so we lay down the groundwork to
be able to skip it when calling attach().

Part of blueprint: use-new-bdm-format-in-attach

Change-Id: Iff3890e39a8c75b1693df0918084ecf4492c4e91
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-03 15:12:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/86c0b013181a6a63936abe5238688a089c872a21', 'message': 'Refactor driver BDM attach() to cover all uses

Add separate flags to allow the execution to skip the
volume_api.check_attach step, and to be able to call the
driver.attach_volume if needed. This will make the method modular enough
to be used in all cases where we actually "attach" volumes to instances.

Check attach should always be done in the API, followed immediately by a
reservation, to minimize the chance of a race. However currently we
do the check_attach step on the compute side during boot, so it needs to
stay. Other operations like attach_volume will have it reserved causing
this check to fail on the compute side, so we lay down the groundwork to
be able to skip it when calling attach().

Likewise, when booting, we don't need to call the virt driver
attach_volume method, as all the devices will be taken care of by the
boot code path.

Part of blueprint: use-new-bdm-format-in-attach

Change-Id: Iff3890e39a8c75b1693df0918084ecf4492c4e91
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-06 13:06:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3f7b8b0e18e0ebc1adca432d643cd293a018972b', 'message': 'Refactor driver BDM attach() to cover all uses

volume_api.check_attach step, and to be able to call the
driver.attach_volume if needed. This will make the method modular enough
to be used in all cases where we actually "attach" volumes to instances.

reservation, to minimize the chance of a race. However currently we
do the check_attach step on the compute side during boot, so it needs to
stay. Other operations like attach_volume will have it reserved causing
this check to fail on the compute side, so we lay down the groundwork to
be able to skip it when calling attach().

Likewise, when booting, we don't need to call the virt driver
attach_volume method, as all the devices will be taken care of by the
boot code path.

Part of blueprint: use-new-bdm-format-in-attach

Change-Id: Iff3890e39a8c75b1693df0918084ecf4492c4e91

do the check_attach step on the compute side during boot, so it needs to
stay. Other operations like attach_volume will have it reserved causing
this check to fail on the compute side, so we lay down the groundwork to
be able to skip it when calling attach().

Likewise, when booting, we don't need to call the virt driver
attach_volume method, as all the devices will be taken care of by the
boot code path.

Part of blueprint: use-new-bdm-format-in-attach

Change-Id: Iff3890e39a8c75b1693df0918084ecf4492c4e91

commit_message:
Refactor driver BDM attach() to cover all uses

Add separate flags to allow the execution to skip the
volume_api.check_attach step, and to be able to call the
driver.attach_volume if needed. This will make the method modular enough
to be used in all cases where we actually "attach" volumes to instances.

Check attach should always be done in the API, followed immediately by a
reservation, to minimize the chance of a race. However currently we
do the check_attach step on the compute side during boot, so it needs to
stay. Other operations like attach_volume will have it reserved causing
this check to fail on the compute side, so we lay down the groundwork to
be able to skip it when calling attach().

Likewise, when booting, we don't need to call the virt driver
attach_volume method, as all the devices will be taken care of by the
boot code path.

Part of blueprint: use-new-bdm-format-in-attach

Change-Id: Iff3890e39a8c75b1693df0918084ecf4492c4e91

commit_message:
Add ceilometer-alarm-* service for SLES install guide

Alarm service is a very important feature for Ceilometer Havana
release, however, the install guide for SLES is missing to install
the openstack-ceilometer-alarm-evaluator and
openstack-ceilometer-alarm-notifier packages.

Change-Id: Ided7a7376a51353ae09653f932e048f62e17e7ed
Partial-Bug: #1278697
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit aa8e55fc32a7a3c04cfdbc471386ff000c40a1b8)

commit_message:
Separate the deleting server tests

"Servers should be always delete-able unless they are lock-ed."
This principle is important, and it is better to separate the
tests from current mixed class of this viewpoint to check the
test coverage.

Change-Id: I9df45f3b0c8395c36b586fd31a1526fb87b63389

commit_message:
Fix error reporting of doctest and parallel builds

Fix error handling in openstack-doc-test, now really abort if an
error occurs. The call to write in the exception was wrong and masked
the exception.

OpenStack infra changed the setup so that we now always destroy a node
after building - and thus have a clean node each time.
Now, when mvn is called, it needs to download lots of files into the
.ml2 repository (previously this was done already).
Now, the cripts start mvn jobs in parallel - and then we get a race
between these downloads and corruption of the .m2 directory.
Avoid this race with waiting for the first build job to finish before
starting further builds.

Add options --parallel/--noparallel to disable parallel building
completely.

Improve debug output.

Related-Bug: #1277082

Change-Id: Ifa62e0bb5b4f655b0d36b9e16bb0bb8adcd4cbd5

commit_message:
Fix logging context to include user_identity

The user_identity generated created from user, tenant, domain
user_domain and project_domain.
The new domain related values are default to None

Closes-Bug: #1283080

commit_message:
Fix test classes name of test_tokens.py

These test classes 'UsersTestJSON' and 'UsersTestXML' were introduced
for testing tokens in
  Change-Id: I9a810844b1d991f829f411db308e37a02bd6c09e
But their names are not suitable for their responsibility.
This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: I2bb51fe147c17846d667be6f259f63dcaeffe3fc

commit_message:
Make floating_ips module use FloatingIP for associations

This makes the network.floating_ips module use the FloatingIP
object for association operations instead of direct database
access.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I71db51e2ad3a79665140ef21b5960c1ff9ff3a05

setting the tenant_id, and then deletes the router.

List projects and domains for groups

List projects and list domains based on a list of group ids.

blueprint saml-id

commit_message:
Add support to get custom localrc file for Devstack engine

While deploying with Devstack engine using Dummy provider it would
be useful to get localrc file from local system or from web. For
example in "devstack-in-dummy.json" custom localrc file can be
given as

"localrc_file": "https://raw2.github.com/user/repo/localrc",
or
"localrc_file": "file:///tmp/localrc",

Change-Id: I906af54bdd86f43aa39bffadd77a69453a7417bf

commit_message:
Force cleanup of devstack for Devstack engine with Dummy provider

This patch adds the support of running unstack.sh and removing
devstack directory while re-creating the devstack environment using
Devstack engine with Dummy provider on the same VM/server.

Change-Id: I189014dcd71965a1e1b952829ba7f52fdf0e74a9

Change Ifac07aba: Add a monkey-patching util for sqlalchemy-migrate

nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py should be changed to be consistent
with ModelBase changes in oslo.db

Changes from oslo-incubator
============================================
b4f72b2 Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
271adfb Format sql in db.sqlalchemy.session docstring
0334cb3 Handle exception messages with six.text_type
eff69ce Drop dependency on log from oslo db code

1b5147f Only enable MySQL TRADITIONAL mode if we're running against MySQL
39e1c5c Move db tests base.py to common code
986dafd Fix parsing of UC errors in sqlite 3.7.16+/3.8.2+
9a203e6 Use dialect rather than a particular DB API driver
1779029 Move helper DB functions to db.sqlalchemy.utils
bcf6d5e Small edits on help strings
ae01e9a Transition from migrate to alembic
70ebb19 Fix mocking of utcnow() for model datetime cols
7aa94df Add a db check for CHARSET=utf8
aff0171 Remove "vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4" from headers
fa0f36f Fix database connection string is secret
8575d87 Removed copyright from empty files
d08d27f Fix the obsolete exception message
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
9bc593e Add docstring for exception handlers of session
855644a Removal of _REPOSITORY global variable.
ea6caf9 Remove string.lowercase usage
a33989e Remove eventlet tpool from common db.api
e40903b Database hook enabling traditional mode at MySQL
f2115a0 Replace xrange in for loop with range
c802fa6 SQLAlchemy error patterns improved
1c1f199 Remove unused import
6d0a6c3 Correct invalid docstrings
135dd00 Remove start index 0 in range()
28f8fd5 Make _extra_keys a property of ModelBase
45658e2 Fix violations of H302:import only modules
bb4d7a2 Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically
915f8ab db.sqlalchemy.session add [sql].idle_timeout
e6494c2 Use six.iteritems to make dict work on Python2/3
48cfb7b Drop dependency on processutils from oslo db code
4c47d3e Fix locking in migration tests
c2ee282 Incorporating MIT licensed code
c5a1088 Typos fix in db and periodic_task module
fb0e86a Use six.moves.configparser instead of ConfigParser
1dd4971 fix typo in db session docstring
8a01dd8 The ability to run tests at various backend
0fe4e28 Use log.warning() instead of log.warn() in oslo.db
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
4c22556 Use py3kcompat urlutils functions instead of urlparse
ca7a2ab Don't use deprecated module commands
6603e8f Remove sqlalchemy-migrate 0.7.3 patching
274c7e2 Drop dependency on lockutils from oslo db code
97d8cf4 Remove lazy loading of database backend
2251cb5 Do not name variables as builtins
3acd57c Add db2 communication error code when check the db connection
c2dcf6e Add [sql].connection as deprecated opt for db
001729d Modify SQLA session due to dispose of eventlet
4de827a Clean up db.sqla.Models.extra_keys interface
347f29e Use functools.wrap() instead of custom implementation
771d843 Move base migration test classes to common code
9721129 exception: remove
56ff3b3 Use single meta when change column type
3f2f70e Helper function to sanitize db url credentials
df3f2ba BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6
c76be5b Add function drop_unique_constraint()
d4d8126 Change sqlalchemy/utils.py mode back to 644
cf41936 Move sqlalchemy migration from Nova
5758360 Raise ValueError if sort_dir is unknown
31c1995 python3: Add python3 compatibility support
3972c3f Migrate sqlalchemy utils from Nova
1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
3f503fa Add a monkey-patching util for sqlalchemy-migrate

Change-Id: I18e7b4a905e6a3a3f00097ddbf0193248c0d0222

commit_message:
Sync latest oslo.db code into nova

Couple of changes in nova/tests was made to work with new TimestampMixin
introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/67484

nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py should be changed to be consistent
with ModelBase changes in oslo.db

commit_message:
Resource tracker: Use Nova objects

The resource tracker is being converted to use Nova objects. This patch
converts the remaining instance, migration and service dicts to their
object forms. By doing this, the conductor import can be removed.

Change-Id: I9b806008c567deb3e07c3b894d45f6de35242c13

commit_message:
Nova should make bigger requests of glance

$nova image-list can often run very slowly (or any image listing done
from nova) due to the fact that when it calls into glanceclient it
typically doesn't specify a page_size and so glanceclient uses its
default of 20.  For larger lists of images (eg. if there were lots of
snapshots, or if there were a lot of public images) this results in a
succession of queries from nova to the glance api server for a small
amount of images at a time.

Add a configuration item to nova image subsystem to allow deployers
to set a larger default query size in glance queries originating from
nova.  If not specified, existing behaviour applies.

Change-Id: I3660a3b963f2b45870287bfb5fd1fbc517ea049b
Closes-bug: 1279832

commit_message:
Add API discovery and commands

* add low-level API discovery support
* add 'api list' and 'api match' commands

This is incomplete WRT other APIs, only Identity is discovered at the moment.

TODO: Fix an issue mocking the ClientManager tests with the addition of
discovery...

commit_message:
Sync request_id middleware for Keystone

Implements RequestIdMiddleware to inject the standard
header 'x-openstack-request-id' in every request and
response.

Change-Id: Ibbb77c1de8f0a04215600436d0a0b56fad2ea4b5
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

commit_message:
Return x-openstack-request-id to be used in Nova

Keystone has been changed to also generate and return the
request id. The Keystone client middleware needs to be changed
to pass the data along with the response. That will allow both
request ids to be logged in Nova.

The change Ibbb77c1de8f0a04215600436d0a0b56fad2ea4b5 is
implementing the Keystone request id middlware.

Change-Id: I45139bc3f984659d7c107066f45a42bc0d930f11
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

commit_message:
Duplicate config items causing errors

I struggled with this for a while, I couldn't get neutron to
stay alive no matter what, getting errors like:
neutron.service: ERROR service.serve_wsgi Error occurred: trying old api-paste.ini.#012Traceback (most recent call last):#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/neutron/service.py", line 96, in serve_wsgi#012    service.start()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/neutron/service.py", line 65, in start#012    self.wsgi_app = _run_wsgi(self.app_name)#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/neutron/service.py", line 110, in _run_wsgi#012    app = config.load_paste_app(app_name)#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/neutron/common/config.py", line 151, in load_paste_app#012    raise RuntimeError(msg)#012RuntimeError: Unable to load neutron from configuration file /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini.

Once I deleted the duplicate items in api-paste, it works

Change-Id: Ib7c06166e996ffb77139e3a9c281231400b60a9a

subject: Fix wrong quota reservation in confirm resize
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 09:32:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/731c8a2340c13c5e3d24c158915ccd1f7b047828', 'message': "Fix wrong quota reservation in auto confirm resize

Currently, if the confirmation is launched through periodic task,
then the project_id and user_id in context are all None, which
result in reservations in DB are also have `NULL` project_id and
user_id, when these reservations are committed, the quotas usage of
the instance's project/user will become wrong eventually.

This change fixes the above bug by copying the generated context,
and filling the copied context's project_id and user_id with
instance's, then the reservations will be committed to correct
project/user.

Closes-bug: #1271429

commit_message:
Fix wrong quota reservation in confirm resize

Currently, if the confirmation is launched through periodic task
or admin user, then the project_id and user_id in context are all
wrong(None all admin user's), which result in reservations in DB
are also have wrong project_id and user_id, when these reservations
are committed, the quotas usage of the instance's project/user
will become wrong eventually.

This change fixes the above bug by using the instance's project_id
and user_id instead of the context's, then the reservations will
be committed to correct project/user.

Co-authored-by: Tiantian Gao <gtt116@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1271429
Closes-bug: #1278686

Change-Id: Ie3e79fb42323dc5cf9f4324c062f11129caad7c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/68342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Added driver certification check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-14 01:06:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/72eeefa64a09fe39accf05862df203c63754e68a', 'message': "Added driver certification check

This patch tries to put a process in
place for checking driver certification.

If a driver hasn't passed certification by
Icehouse-3, then the driver gets updated and
marked as being uncertified.

When the volume manager starts and it tries to
init the uncertified driver, the volume manager
logs an error saying the driver is uncertified.
The volume manager leaves the driver in the
uninitialized state, which disables the driver.

This patch also adds an override for cinder.conf.
The override allows an admin to configure cinder
to allow the volume manager to start uncertified
drivers.

Change-Id: I82d4b45e4db531c129650dcca14459d7a5965cca
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-14 02:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/fake_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a198d246915dc050d9922f1e13eac4c9d348cbc6', 'message': "Added driver certification check

This patch puts a process in
place for checking driver certification.

This patch marks all drivers as uncertified.

Every driver needs a follow on patch that
includes a link to a bug that contains the
certification log passing.  The patch should
include self.certified = True in the driver's
__init__.

When the volume manager starts and it tries to
init the uncertified driver, the volume manager
logs an error saying the driver is uncertified.
The volume manager leaves the driver in the
uninitialized state, which disables the driver.

This patch also adds an override for cinder.conf.
The override allows an admin to configure cinder
to allow the volume manager to start uncertified
drivers.

Change-Id: I82d4b45e4db531c129650dcca14459d7a5965cca
"}]
commit_message:
Added driver certification check

This patch puts a process in
place for checking driver certification.

This patch marks all drivers as uncertified.

Every driver needs a follow on patch that
includes a link to a bug that contains the
certification log passing.  The patch should
include self.certified = True in the driver's
__init__.

When the volume manager starts and it tries to
init the uncertified driver, the volume manager
logs an error saying the driver is uncertified.
The volume manager leaves the driver in the
uninitialized state, which disables the driver.

This patch also adds an override for cinder.conf.
The override allows an admin to configure cinder
to allow the volume manager to start uncertified
drivers.

Change-Id: I82d4b45e4db531c129650dcca14459d7a5965cca

work in the gate either because of improper test setup or missing
devstack configuration.

commit_message:
py3kcompat: remove in ceilometer

Everything is already in six>=1.4.0 and we already depend on such a
version. There's no reason to keep this file. So remove py3kcompat
from ceilometer.

Closes-Bug: #1280033

Change-Id: I497841c92f1ef3b62eb3326d50cd291590f40d51

commit_message:
Allow log files audit

Reason:
- audit process is required for database management;

Changes:
- adding required parameters for trove-api and -taskmanager
  services that would allow audit;

Change-Id: I8368eb60b952f6d997f1ff33ddd9f726d2f97f57
Implements: blueprint dbinstance-log

subject: Plugins should call __init__ of db_base_plugin for db.configure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 02:24:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/664e591c3c7e3f72bd423e13dbb0ccd98eb6e261', 'message': "Plugins should call __init__ of db_base_plugin for db.configure

Currently each plugin calls db.configure() within the plugin's __init__
class or defines an initialize() method that's sole job is to call this
method. Instead we should just call the super method of a plugin so that
db.configure() is called for us out of the db_base_plugin class.

Note: the only reason why I'm making this change is that I want to add
something to the __init__() class of the db_base_plugin that's needed for
the nova-event-callback blueprint and adding it in the base class of init
looks to be the best place.

Change-Id: Iec3c912735021ceb90f657108aad3a57460d66e7

commit_message:
Plugins should call __init__ of db_base_plugin for db.configure

Currently each plugin calls db.configure() within the plugin's __init__
class or defines an initialize() method that's sole job is to call this
method. Instead we should just call the super method of a plugin so that
db.configure() is called for us out of the db_base_plugin class.

Note: the only reason why I'm making this change is that I want to add
something to the __init__() class of the db_base_plugin that's needed for
the nova-event-callback blueprint and adding it in the base class of init
looks to be the best place.

Change-Id: Iec3c912735021ceb90f657108aad3a57460d66e7
Closes-bug: #1282303
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/96/74896/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rename Security Groups related methods for VMware NSX plugin

Second to last step for the renaming/refactoring of nvplib
and related modules. This is about security groups.

Partial-implements blueprint nicira-plugin-renaming

Change-Id: I0099bf25be77fdec90d515c890b728a477409ef9

commit_message:
Add ability to prompt for passwords for user create and set

* Add get_password method to the utilities
* Add --password-prompt option
* Call the get_password method if a prompt is requested
* Various tests

Change-Id: I1786ad531e2a2fbcc21b8bc86aac0ccd7985995a
Closes-Bug: 1100116

subject: Skip exercises that use swiftclient cli on grizzly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 17:41:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/a4ef9faee23e5ef0da9abad889252424a358664d', 'message': 'Skip exercises that use swiftclient cli on grizzly

With the push of v2.0 swiftclient the install of swfitclient on grizzly
stops working because the version is capped <2. This causes pip to
freak out replace the bin/swift script but leave the code from master
at >2 in the swiftclient namespace. This disconnect causes the exercises
that use the swiftclient cli to fail with import errors in the bin/swift
script. This commit skips these exercises to avoid the failures.

Change-Id: I2f9afdae4ae091c7de6ba3397fce5b6ee0980014
'}]
commit_message:
Skip exercises that use swiftclient cli on grizzly

With the push of v2.0 swiftclient the install of swfitclient on grizzly
stops working because the version is capped <2. This causes pip to
freak out replace the bin/swift script but leave the code from master
at >2 in the swiftclient namespace. This disconnect causes the exercises
that use the swiftclient cli to fail with import errors in the bin/swift
script. This commit skips these exercises to avoid the failures.

Change-Id: I2f9afdae4ae091c7de6ba3397fce5b6ee0980014

commit_message:
Fix docstring of parsing order

There is wrong explaination of option parsing order in config files
and on command line. That is only the later one takes action.
The sample code shows only the later one takes action.
See http://paste.openstack.org/show/64229/

Change-Id: I4d48df1b551bb130dc25fe32303fa2d0b1fecffd

commit_message:
Trivial changes from oslo-incubator

A number of trivial changes were merged to the oslo-incubator copy of
the rootwrap code while the code was being graduated. Those changes
should have been rejected (as the code was frozen while in graduation)
and applied to oslo.rootwrap instead.

Now that the oslo-incubator copy of the code was removed, we should
reapply those trivial changes to oslo.rootwrap instead, otherwise they
will just be lost:

* Remove vim header (original author: jogo)
* Make vertical white space after license header consistent (noorul)
* Removed copyright from empty files (jay-lau)

Change-Id: I0403335b8ec151e2337d50935be18355cc55a199

commit_message:
Bind Marconi to SERVICE_HOST & add health check

This patch,
1. Binds Marconi to SERVICE_HOST, to be consistent with other services.
2. Adds a health check to verify if marconi started correctly.

subject: Raise error on long or short DLO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 05:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/25ebf3aa9e6e98974565ae1b70fc05b49423e17c', 'message': "Raise error on long or short DLO

The GET response for a DLO has a Content-Length that's computed from
the container listing, but the response body's length is determined by
the segments. If a segment grows or shrinks between when the headers
are sent and when the segment is requested, this confuses clients.

For example, if the DLO is longer than its Content-Length and the
client sends another request on the same TCP connection, then it can
get leftover object bytes instead of an HTTP status line.
Alternately, if the headers it sends fill up the TCP buffers since
Swift won't read them until the first response is done, then deadlock
hilarity ensues.

If the DLO is shorter than its Content-Length, you're pretty much
guaranteed a deadlock: the client is waiting for the rest of the
response, and the server is waiting for a new request.

Now SegmentedIterable detects both these conditions and raises an
exception so that the TCP connection gets torn down. It can't save
this request, but it can stop the next one from getting hosed too.

Change-Id: Icf79ba046ef7aaaab49ce6d0b33147332c967afc
"}]
commit_message:
Raise error on long or short DLO

The GET response for a DLO has a Content-Length that's computed from
the container listing, but the response body's length is determined by
the segments. If a segment grows or shrinks between when the headers
are sent and when the segment is requested, this confuses clients.

For example, if the DLO is longer than its Content-Length and the
client sends another request on the same TCP connection, then it can
get leftover object bytes instead of an HTTP status line.
Alternately, if the headers it sends fill up the TCP buffers since
Swift won't read them until the first response is done, then deadlock
hilarity ensues.

If the DLO is shorter than its Content-Length, you're pretty much
guaranteed a deadlock: the client is waiting for the rest of the
response, and the server is waiting for a new request.

Now SegmentedIterable detects both these conditions and raises an
exception so that the TCP connection gets torn down. It can't save
this request, but it can stop the next one from getting hosed too.

Change-Id: Icf79ba046ef7aaaab49ce6d0b33147332c967afc

commit_message:
Add Storage Policy Support to list_endpoints

This patch makes list_endpoints policy aware and adds plumbing required
for existing test cases to pass as well as unit tests as needed to
assure policy coverage.

Change-Id: Ia866ddc14ffafda0c791b5fe4f2e81c4178405c2
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

of copying test base classes and fixtures out of the
incubator.

Change-Id: Ib198e013462ad07d29347aa9171f03f5803c7396

commit_message:
L3 Agent restart causes network outage

When a L3 agent controlling multiple qrouter namespaces
restarts, it destroys all qrouter namespaces even if
some of them are still in use.  As a result, network
traffic could be stopped on the VMs that use the
networks associated with these namespaces.

So what is needed is for the L3 agent to preserve those
qrouter namespaces a L3 agent instance recognizes and to
destroy those it does not know about.

Closes-Bug: #1175695

Change-Id: Idae77886bd195d773878c3d212ccfd56269216fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/30988/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support to request vnic type on port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-10 13:01:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/30e4b5105f9fa06eaa5c55a895a1896a5f975a9f', 'message': "Add support to request vnic type on port

This patch adds support for requested vnic_type to be plugged to neutron port to ML2 plugin.
This patch contains:
1. New attribute 'binding:vnic_type' added to port binding extension.
   Possible values are 'direct', 'macvtap' and 'virtio'.
   'binding:vnic_type' is allowed to be defined on port creation by
admin or tenant user.
   'binding:vnic_type' can be also skipped in port defintion
2. Management of vnic_type by ML2 plugin, assuming default
vnic_type=virtio
3. Add 'vnic_type' to ml2_port_bindings DB table
4. Add supported vnic_types for MechasmDrivers that are capable to bind
port.
5. Add DB migration script for ml2_vnic_type.

Change-Id: Ic88708fa9ece742f807c1d09bb49e499f99bd092
Implements: blueprint ml2-request-vnic-type
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-10 14:34:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b9b3ac69da2fc4dced7553f1a486153513069943', 'message': "Add support to request vnic type on port

This patch adds support for requested vnic_type to be plugged to neutron port to ML2 plugin.
This patch contains:
1. New attribute 'binding:vnic_type' added to port binding extension.
   Possible values are 'direct', 'macvtap' and 'virtio'.
   'binding:vnic_type' is allowed to be defined on port creation by
admin or tenant user.
   'binding:vnic_type' can be also skipped in port defintion
2. Management of vnic_type by ML2 plugin, assuming default
vnic_type=virtio
3. Add 'vnic_type' to ml2_port_bindings DB table
4. Add supported vnic_types for MechasmDrivers that are capable to bind
port.

commit_message:
Add support to request vnic type on port

This patch adds support for requested vnic_type to be plugged to neutron port to ML2 plugin.
This patch contains:
1. New attribute 'binding:vnic_type' added to port binding extension.
   Possible values are 'direct', 'macvtap' and 'normal'.
   'binding:vnic_type' is allowed to be defined on port creation or changed
   on port update by admin or tenant user.
   'binding:vnic_type' can be also skipped in port defintion
2. Management of vnic_type by ML2 plugin, assuming default
vnic_type=normal
3. Add 'vnic_type' to ml2_port_bindings DB table
4. Add supported vnic_types for MechanismDrivers that are capable to bind
port.
5. Add DB migration script for ml2_vnic_type.

DocImpact: Need to update portbindings API docs and include in SR-IOV user docs

Change-Id: Ic88708fa9ece742f807c1d09bb49e499f99bd092
Implements: blueprint ml2-request-vnic-type

commit_message:
Limit logged headers in proxy_logging middleware

Currently all headers are logged if access_log_headers are enabled in
proxy_logging middleware. By adding the option access_log_headers_only
it is now possible to limit the logged headers to the given header values.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I0a1e40567c9eddc9bb00dd00373dc6eeb33d347c

commit_message:
Remove __del__ usage in vmwareapi driver

The vmwareapi driver uses __del__ in an inappropriate way, which
causes spurious errors to be displayed at inconvenient times. The
python docs clearly detail the caveats of using __del__ (and even
provide a big red warning). This removes the offending code, which
can't work reliably anyway.

Closes-bug: 1262288
Change-Id: I50acb4f1e85650f4c6dffe1a1d25842601be96bf

subject: Add ceilometer-alarm-* service for SLES install guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 11:58:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/a9fb5bf4d1a2ff3976cf5e9323412d73f43c6446', 'message': 'Add ceilometer-alarm-* service for SLES install guide

Alarm service is a very important feature for Ceilometer Havana
release, however, the install guide for SLES is missing to install
the openstack-ceilometer-alarm-evaluator and
openstack-ceilometer-alarm-notifier packages, this patch fixes this
problem and provides a workaround for them.

The workaround is needed because SLES uses killproc to kill process
in service script, but killproc identifies processes by their
basename, which is truncated to 16 characters due to linux proc model.
This patch simply shorten the name of Ceilometer alarm services.

Change-Id: Ided7a7376a51353ae09653f932e048f62e17e7ed
Partial-Bug: #1278697
backport: havana
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-20 12:35:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/c6ea061bca3f8825c10b38f07b4590087b9e419a', 'message': 'Add ceilometer-alarm-* service for SLES install guide

commit_message:
Add ceilometer-alarm-* service for SLES install guide

Alarm service is a very important feature for Ceilometer Havana
release, however, the install guide for SLES is missing to install
the openstack-ceilometer-alarm-evaluator and
openstack-ceilometer-alarm-notifier packages.

Change-Id: Ided7a7376a51353ae09653f932e048f62e17e7ed
Partial-Bug: #1278697
backport: havana

commit_message:
Add test for OS::Neutron::Router Heat resource

Added a test that checks that a OS::Neutron::Router is created
correctly.
Replaced all OS::Quantum with OS::Neutron.
Replaced all Ref with get_param or get_resource.
Lower case instead of Upper case when applies.

Change-Id: I9f4828eee8517422847c05fbb45530699abe8e96
Partial-Bug: #1269569

commit_message:
Use six.moves cStringIO instead of cStringIO

to keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.cStringIO to
replace StringIO

Change-Id: Id89c6156d9bba0007e8b16cd2cc28413a7cc5fd3
Closes-Bug: #1280964

commit_message:
Make endpoint type configurable

Allow to specify the endpoint type to use for each service. Not everybody will
want to use publicURL, so let's make this configurable.

Closes-Bug: #1178083
Change-Id: Idb414aef7510178efef59cb48149ff1d86f11cb1

commit_message:
Fixed a problem in iSCSI multipath

Multipathing for attach volume and detach volume operations
doesn't work properly if there are different targets
associated with different portals for a mulitpath device.

Change-Id: Iab316526cf64de60325d90043f73fa3e83fafb4e
Closes-Bug: #1266051

subject: Fix migration.db_version when no tables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-22 00:14:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_migration_common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/0f24d82afc9d8ebfbbd7b2488f00f43ed5314902', 'message': "Fix migration.db_version when no tables

When db_version was called and the database wasn't controlled
it would call db_version_control without an engine which would
lead to an unexpected error being raised:

 TypeError: coercing to Unicode: need string or buffer, int found

This is because it was passing the version (an int) where the
argument is supposed to be the path.

Change-Id: Ie724c2c53ba9da3206a28a0e9d3725ed0f170579
"}]
commit_message:
Fix migration.db_version when no tables

When db_version was called and the database wasn't controlled
it would call db_version_control without an engine which would
lead to an unexpected error being raised:

 TypeError: coercing to Unicode: need string or buffer, int found

This is because it was passing the version (an int) where the
argument is supposed to be the path.

Change-Id: Ie724c2c53ba9da3206a28a0e9d3725ed0f170579

commit_message:
Cinder test to integration tests was added

* Now integration tests have a check for Cinder.

While Heat is not correctly working with Cinder volumes (bug #1281534).
I think we should turn off Cinder test when using Heat as infrastructure engine for Savanna.
When bug #1281534 will be fixed, we will turn on Cinder test when using Heat as infrastructure engine for Savanna.

implements: blueprint cinder-support-in-i-tests

Change-Id: Iee845e4b20bfbe49d97e75e6666f35c2f727d5e5

commit_message:
Fixed check in image cache unit test

Before the fix assert checked nothing bacause .sort() sorts
provided list and has no return. Comparison of two None objects
is always true.

Change-Id: I3d453a29b5913cd24ce8d9e4a2324c7ad8d138b7

commit_message:
Add support_status attribute to properties schema

The fix for some bugs will require the deprecating of some existing
properties. This attribute will be used by the documentation generation
to indicate the support status of a given property, which will generally
be SUPPORTED or DEPRECATED.

Change-Id: Idf4b44aa5b8a5a3a1a9fe8f5f62466fdef4c4eae

commit_message:
Copy the __init__.py from openstack.common

Code has been added in the __init__.py now in the root
directory, so update.py needs to sync this file as well
earlier this file was empty, so we just used to ensure
that the file was created.

Change-Id: Ic9ebc43bce7a5a1ef414957b53055588dfc4d188

commit_message:
VMware: raise more specific exceptions

In certain cases the exception handling for backend errors
would be handled too broadly. This patch elevates the backend exception
to the application so that it can treat specific errors.

In the application we can now handle the following specific exceptions:
- FileAlreadyExists - for example when moving a directory to a directory
that already exists
- InvalidProperty - for example when using neutron and opaque networks
are not supported
- AlreadyExists - for example a port group already exists
- NotAuthenticated - for example the operation is denied as because a
session is not established
- CannotDeleteFile - the file cannot be deleted
- FileFault - a file access exception
- FileLocked - an attempt is made to lock a file that is
already in use
- FileNotFound - the specific file does not exist

Change-Id: I789165f3879ec5df73f72c2737377e0fcfc99656

commit_message:
Fix import order in test_excutils

The tests.unit.test_excutils module would fail to import by
itself because it couldn't import the mox modules from six.moves.
This is because the mox module is registered with six.moves in
openstack.common's __init__ and that hadn't been imported yet.

The fix is to use mox from moxstubout since that part imported
mox already.

Change-Id: I786b9bffba28935f59da0dcf84ef2b5aa3f2b58d

commit_message:
Add log_dir param. by default and allow users to disable it

This commit add log_dir param and configures it to /var/log/keystone
(default location). Set log_dir to false allows users to disable logging
to a directory (usefull if syslog is enabled in order not to log twice).

Change-Id: I83446ff8b70c1cc136c9e1bb24513006ac9cb5a8
Closes-bug: #1282296

commit_message:
Fix interactive mode with command line args

The cmdloop in cmd2 looks for a --test option in the parsed arguments which doesn't work if you want to pass other arguments in interactive mode.  If any other arguments are passed in, an exception is thrown.

Change-Id: Iacd3d338dce74f4de9eaf5c9c8ad8ac9f9ae32e3
Closes-Bug: #1103218

commit_message:
Config generator fails with lazy messages

Entry points from modules loaded from projects may have help text
that is i18n lazy enabled, which causes a failure because
gettextutils.Message (a subclass of six.text_type) explicitly
does not support concatenation.  Change from using concatenation
to using format (%) to allow six.text_type to do the right thing.

Change-Id: Ie60c569ae6fe227e16eef4a3281cf042732addc3
Closes-Bug: #1280826

commit_message:
feat(sqlalchemy): add shards controller

This patch focuses on providing the shards controller for sqlalchemy.

As a bonus, a decorator is added that flags all methods that handles
all methods that raise a connection error.

The sqlalchemy driver passes all unit tests for the shards
controller. The initial suite is running on the sqlite engine.

A few general fixes have been applied:

- shards listing unit test now uses characters for names rather than
  numbers as strings to avoid sorting variations between storage
  engines
- cache.get_cache no longer takes a configOpts object

Change-Id: I7400884244be94f7600a5fb489b38c7058d36b31
Partially-Implements: blueprint: sql-storage-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/35/71335/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix doc build with Python 2.6.x

subprocess.check_output was new in Python 2.7.
Use an alternative construct via subprocess.Popen
which works on Python 2.6 as well.

Change-Id: I0b44fc19183f1c6b23fe5a9cce31de381809534d
