subject: Use different context for each API request in unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-14 16:21:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/52d9e1ac892c821fda93929136d2b1b8b73f3ab5', 'message': 'NSX svc plugin: flush session before starting task

With this change, the session in the request context is flushed
explicitly before starting a task. Task callbacks will use the
same context and therefore the same session, and the session
migth have uncommitted changes pertaining to a DB state which
might have been altered by other transactions.

Change-Id: I4895faa00ebd915eb9e259930db2d004a9e78a86
Closes-Bug: #1280035
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-20 11:51:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e8db231329cf1dcc1f83c09b51835fbb68a3d079', 'message': 'Use different context for each API request in unit tests

test_router_add_interface_subnet_with_port_from_other_tenant in
neutron.tests.unit.test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseBase was mocking
neutron.context.Context thus performing multiple API requests
with the same context instance. As a context instance also has
a DB session attribute, this might cause unexpected side effects,
especially for plugins which process request asynchronously.

The plugin neutron.plugins.nicira.NeutronServicePlugin was being
affected.

This patch ensures each request has a different context object
without changing the unit test semantics.

It also refactors slightly test_edge_router.py in the nicira
unit test package to avoid executing twice the same unit tests.

Change-Id: I4895faa00ebd915eb9e259930db2d004a9e78a86
Closes-Bug: #1280035
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-20 16:08:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/22280fd3f65c58b6840e2cf639d1d2392747de13', 'message': 'Use different context for each API request in unit tests

test_router_add_interface_subnet_with_port_from_other_tenant in
neutron.tests.unit.test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseBase was mocking
neutron.context.Context thus performing multiple API requests
with the same context instance. As a context instance also has
a DB session attribute, this might cause unexpected side effects,
especially for plugins which process request asynchronously.

The plugin neutron.plugins.nicira.NeutronServicePlugin was being
affected.

This patch ensures each request has a different context object
without changing the unit test semantics.

It also refactors slightly test_edge_router.py in the nicira
unit test package to avoid executing twice the same unit tests.

Removed from the gate due to failures.

Change-Id: I4895faa00ebd915eb9e259930db2d004a9e78a86
Closes-Bug: #1280035
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-21 00:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_edge_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fcad26e394cd6021aab2c94f1179533cc7866f8c', 'message': 'Use different context for each API request in unit tests

test_router_add_interface_subnet_with_port_from_other_tenant in
neutron.tests.unit.test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseBase was mocking
neutron.context.Context thus performing multiple API requests
with the same context instance. As a context instance also has
a DB session attribute, this might cause unexpected side effects,
especially for plugins which process request asynchronously.

The plugin neutron.plugins.nicira.NeutronServicePlugin was being
affected.

This patch ensures each request has a different context object
without changing the unit test semantics.

It also refactors slightly test_edge_router.py in the nicira
unit test package to avoid executing twice the same unit tests.

Change-Id: I4895faa00ebd915eb9e259930db2d004a9e78a86
Closes-Bug: #1280035
'}]
commit_message:
Use different context for each API request in unit tests

test_router_add_interface_subnet_with_port_from_other_tenant in
neutron.tests.unit.test_l3_plugin.L3NatTestCaseBase was mocking
neutron.context.Context thus performing multiple API requests
with the same context instance. As a context instance also has
a DB session attribute, this might cause unexpected side effects,
especially for plugins which process request asynchronously.

The plugin neutron.plugins.nicira.NeutronServicePlugin was being
affected.

This patch ensures each request has a different context object
without changing the unit test semantics.

It also refactors slightly test_edge_router.py in the nicira
unit test package to avoid executing twice the same unit tests.

Change-Id: I4895faa00ebd915eb9e259930db2d004a9e78a86
Closes-Bug: #1280035

commit_message:
Make neutron extension sections titles consistent

This patch simply ensures that for each neutron extension,
it section title also report the exception alias in the title,
wrapped by a <literal> tag.

Closes-Bug: 1242033

Change-Id: Ic6f39d6e5563704ceec60440affc5085fefd9d76

commit_message:
Included instance migration using snapshots

Included new procedure for migrating an instance using snapshots in the
User guide.
Closes-bug: #1244353

Change-Id: I6b4606e923682161fe6c21dd0ccabd92184af937

commit_message:
enable 100-continue for RadosGW

Now that we have FastCGI packages with Inktank patches enabling
100-continue, we can tell RadosGW to use it.

Change-Id: I25b172dc8cbd54105a156a6d86deb5d859a1edb6
Closes-bug: #1276187

commit_message:
Fix ValueError in ip_lib.IpRouteCommand.get_gateway()

As metric is not necessarily the 5th word of the gateway line, the
method should search the string 'metric' in the line and pick the next
word as the metric value.

Change-Id: I2663ddbae82f80b912b364c07f9ab92c5b90b718
Closes-Bug: #1267790

commit_message:
Add support for qos_specs feature to 3PAR drivers

This patch includes the ability to set the qos-specs for the
existing 3PAR qos settings (maxIOP and maxBWS) in addition to
the new settingis listed below. We would prefer that the
new qos-specs associated to a volume type be used, but this
patch also supports setting these values the old way in extra-specs
for backwards compatibility.

This patch also adds two additional personas to the list of
valid personas that are now support by the 3PAR backends.

DocImpact: Implements new qos settings
minIOPS - The minimum IOPs per second
minBWS - The minimum bandwidth per second
latency - The QOS I/O target latency
priority - The QOS scheduling priority (high, normal, low)
The priority defaults to normal

Two new personas added include HPUX and WindowsServer

Change-Id: I7f94a493919dc2d34daac91d684369d1f51c974c
Implements: blueprint add-qosspec-support-to-3par-drivers

subject: Update 3PAR drivers to pass cert test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-10 21:16:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4dab55868e8dec85283d1039b12e375a54d9a13d', 'message': 'Update 3PAR drivers to pass cert test

This patch updates both the HP 3PAR Fibre Channel
and HP 3PAR iSCSI block storage drivers so that they
can pass the driver certification tests.  We also updated
the unit tests to use mock instead of mox.

These versions of the drivers require the new 3.0.0 hp3parclient,
which can be downloaded from the pypi repository:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hp3parclient
The new hp3parclient requires the 3.1.3 firmware on the HP 3PAR.

The driver certification results:
Related-Bug: #1278575
Related-Bug: #1278577

Change-Id: I72e0a76c865e54c58e41cc4409555d9042e30267
DocImpact: Document new driver requirements.

commit_message:
Update 3PAR drivers to pass cert test

This patch updates both the HP 3PAR Fibre Channel
and HP 3PAR iSCSI block storage drivers so that they
can pass the driver certification tests.  We also updated
the unit tests to use mock instead of mox.

These versions of the drivers require the new 3.0.0 hp3parclient,
which can be downloaded from the pypi repository:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hp3parclient
The new hp3parclient requires the 3.1.3 firmware on the HP 3PAR.

The driver certification results:
Related-Bug: #1278575
Related-Bug: #1278577

Closes-Bug: #1279137

Change-Id: I72e0a76c865e54c58e41cc4409555d9042e30267
DocImpact: Document new driver requirements.
